2.description: At the forefront of AI transformation, the UBC AI Club is dedicated to driving innovation, democratizing cutting-edge AI knowledge for all students, and forging strong, collaborative partnerships. We are on a mission to establish UBC as Canada’s leading hub for AI education and development.

5.club_name: AMS Alternative Community Club at UBC

6.club_name: AMS Anthropology Students Association (ASA) at UBC
6.description: Welcome to the Anthropology Students' Association (ASA) at UBC! Our mission is to enrich the experience of both prospective and current anthropology students by offering accessible, high-quality programs that foster learning and connection. We strive to build a strong, supportive community, provide leadership opportunities, and advocate for student interests within the UBC Department of Anthropology and beyond. Whether you're just discovering anthropology or deeply engaged in the field, the ASA is here to support your academic journey and connect you with like-minded peers.

7.club_name: AMS Applied Machine Learning & Art @ UBC

8.club_name: AMS Arab Student Association at UBC

9.club_name: AMS Armenian Student Association at UBC
9.description: The Armenian Student Association at UBC seeks to foster a vibrant and inclusive community dedicated to promoting and celebrating the Armenian culture, language, and history. Our purpose is to provide a platform for UBC students to connect with their heritage, build meaningful connections as well as share everything that we proudly call “Armenian” – encompassing unique traditions, food, dances, the language, and alphabet – with the larger UBC student body. Thus, our club serves as a resource first and foremost for those curious about Armenia. Our hope is that the Armenian Student Association at UBC will be able to offer that unique Armenian experience, perspective, and immerse UBC students of all backgrounds in our culture.

10.description: AMS Artelier at UBC aims to offer local support for artists who either have their own small business or want to start their own small business, provide a safe and judgment-free space for artists to hone their crafts and begin learning the logistical sides of owning a business at a small scale, and give artists with opportunities to sell their work in a controlled space and provide constructive feedback to allow members to grow. Artelier also provides artists with opportunities to sell their work in beginner-friendly settings to promote growth. Our main events consist of workshops, webinars, and markets.

11.club_name: AMS Asian Brush Calligraphy at UBC
11.description: Hello! 大家好！はじめまして！반갑습니다! We are AMS Asian Brush Calligraphy (UBC ABC for short), a student run AMS club that aims to promote and practice the various brush calligraphies of Asia. We host weekly practice sessions where one can ink their first brush strokes, or hone their skills in Chinese (书法, Shufa), Japanese (書道, Shodo) or Korean (서예, Seoye) calligraphy.

12.club_name: AMS Autism Associates Club at UBC
12.description: AMS Autism Associates Club at UBC is a warm and welcoming student-led community devoted to raising awareness about autism and embracing neurodiversity We strive to raise awareness about autism and foster a supportive, inclusive environment for both autistic and allistic individuals. The club’s mission centers around disseminating knowledge about autism across campus, providing active engagement opportunities that integrate classroom learning, and encouraging students to explore the diverse challenges faced by individuals on the autism spectrum. We aim to create a network of allies who advocate for the needs of autistic individuals and build a more inclusive community both at UBC and beyond.

13.club_name: AMS BC Young Liberals at UBC

14.club_name: AMS BPSc Student Association at UBC

15.description: Hello! Welcome to the UBC Baking Club. We're super excited to have you here! Whether you're a seasoned baking pro or are completely new to baking, we hope you enjoy your time here and create something you can really be proud of! In addition to hosting workshops at UBC, we also have an outreach team dedicated to hosting workshops in the local community for vulnerable populations. Note: Please note that membership fees are $10 for UBC students and $15 for non-UBC students for the ENTIRE school year. We do not have events in the summer.

17.description: AMS Barista Club's core goal is to create an open community for coffee enthusiasts, offering a platform for students to connect, learn, and explore the world of coffee in various ways. Despite the growing coffee industry in Vancouver and the keen interest of many students in coffee culture and cafe work, limited opportunities exist, often constrained by time, budget, and background limitations. To bridge this gap, our club aims to provide students easily accessible experiences that offer foundational knowledge and chances to learn diverse coffee-related skills, all without requiring employment at a cafe or paying for private lessons.

18.club_name: AMS Belly Dance Club at UBC

19.description: We're so glad you're here UBC Mountain Bike Club is located on the unceded traditional territories of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations. We acknowledge their ancestors who nourished the land for centuries before it was stolen. This is the land that we have the privilege of riding on and learning from today. ​ There are incredible programs and organizations throughout BC that work to unite mountain biking and indigenous communities. We encourage you to learn more about their work and how to contribute. Who are we? UBC Mountain Bike Club was (re)established in the Fall of 2022 by a few passionate mountain bikers at UBC. The club started as a group chat with some friends who wanted a fellow community of bikers. In time, we have grown into an official UBC club with over 75 members. Each of us are at different levels of riding, we have different backgrounds and experiences, but we are connected through our appreciation of the outdoors and our love for riding bikes! We organize bike rides, social events, and mountain bike trips for our members. All are welcome in our space.

20.description: our mission We provide students and the wider community with an accessible environment where they can learn to fix bicycles, share resources, and work together. We engage in cycling education, outreach and advocacy to promote biking as a safe and sustainable means of transportation. Sustainability and responsible consumption are important parts of the Bike Kitchen’s mission. That is why we recycle and reuse bicycles – not only does it keep bikes out of the landfill, but it also enables us to build bikes out of used parts for our various programs . Check us out in the basement of the Life Building, room 36. You can get a free assessment for your bicycle, then either pay us to repair the bike for you OR rent a stand and tools and get help fixing the bike yourself! Come volunteer with us every Tuesday evening, between 6.15-9pm; drop in, no registration or experience required! Or check out our events calendar and join a volunteer orientation to learn more!

22.description: Welcome, reader. We're glad you're here! The UBC Book Club is a vibrant and inclusive community for book lovers of all kinds. Whether you've just picked up your first book in years, or have already met your Goodreads reading goal, we're happy to have you. How does the book club work? Every month, our members choose a new book based on a different theme or genre, offering a fresh perspective with every book. We then host in-person discussion meetings on the last Sunday and Monday of each month to talk about the chosen book in detail. Likes, dislikes, favourite characters, twists and turns - you name it! You can also stay connected through Discord for spoiler-safe chapter chats to discuss with other members as you read. The book club also hosts lively socials, such as book swaps, craft nights, movie screenings, and much more. Our goal is to help you find the bookish community you've always dreamed of. There is always something fun on the horizon!

23.description: AMS Bowling Club at UBC is a place for bowlers of all skill levels to engage in bowling outings with a friendly group of bowlers. Our community is beginner-friendly, so if it’s been a while since you last bowled, fret not! We’ve got you covered! Join us for regular bowling outings at a discounted rate and a welcoming group  of avid bowlers.

24.club_name: AMS British Students' Association at UBC

26.description: A UBC student-led initiative that aims to bring together undergraduate students interested in just and equitable city planning and its various branches.

27.club_name: AMS Calisthenics and Body Improvement Club at UBC
27.description: Our goal is to encourage students of all fitness levels to work out in a fun and accessible way through calisthenics!

28.description: Welcome! The purpose and mission of our club is to create a community of support for collegian puppy raisers at UBC, while actively advocating for accessibility on campus and educating the general community about assistance dogs. We educate, fundraise, and raise/train life-changing assistance dogs in partnership with PADS.

29.club_name: AMS Canadian Association for Security and Intelligence Studies  (CASIS) at UBC
29.description: Our club intends to provide career development opportunities and engagement to students interested in national security and intelligence issues through research, dissemination, and discussion. We aim to create a community in which students from all disciplines can be empowered and interact with each other and with industry professionals to apply and enhance their personal knowledge of security studies, develop or enhance their knowledge in the broader realm of international relations, political science, and more. Students can additionally engage in panel discussions, a monthly professional speaker series, and other events with speakers from intelligence, security, and academic backgrounds. Topics of discussion will relate to a broad range of security problems such as domestic extremism, foreign interference in Canada, and more. In this fashion, students will be offered a valuable opportunity to build marketable skills including leadership qualities, problem-solving tendencies, research skills, and more. On the whole, we believe that engagement with industry professionals, gaining insights on security trends, and the promotion of a community of like-minded students will contribute to a valuable forum for students to pursue their career goals and advance into professional roles.

30.description: Who We Are - The University of British Columbia Cancer Association was created to support those affected by cancer in the UBC community and beyond. We are a student led philanthropic club that raises funds to support survivors and raises awareness about cancer related issues and resources. What We Do - The UBCCA hosts many initiatives throughout the year that address different aspects of cancer support. We host fundraising events that culminate with our biggest event of the year Relay for Life. Through our social media and educational events we spread awareness and cancer education. We also host bi-monthly support sessions and socials for people in the UBC community affected by cancer. Who You Could Be - If you are passionate about helping people affected by cancer you belong in this club! Whether you have your own experiences with cancer, have supported a loved one through their cancer journey, or have a purely compassionate connection, we would love to have you on our team.

31.club_name: AMS Casual Baseball Club at UBC
31.description: AMS Casual Baseball Club at UBC We use Japanese rubber baseballs Wanna play baseball? We got you! We host Sports/Social events! All levels welcome!

33.club_name: AMS Central American Students Association (CASAUBC) at UBC
33.description: As the first Central American organization at UBC, the Central American Student Association (CASA) is dedicated to celebrating and sharing the rich cultures, histories, and traditions of Central America. We strive to bridge the gap between Central American students and the local community by providing a safe space for dialogue and hosting educational, cultural, networking, and social events. CASA also aims to serve as a connection hub between Central Americans and the broader Latin American community in Vancouver. Through advocacy, outreach, professional and educational opportunities, we seek to empower our Central American community members to become the best they can be, and to be a CASA, a home away from home, at UBC.

34.club_name: AMS Central Asian Student Union (CASU) at UBC
34.description: At the Central Asian Student Union, you are welcomed whether you are Central Asian or not. Central Asia is a diverse region with a rich history and includes the following countries: Mongolia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan.

35.description: Climate Justice UBC, formerly called UBCC350, is a group of students who organize to tackle climate change and its root causes. Through our campaigns, we advocate for government action on climate policy, political engagement, institutional climate leadership, environmental justice, and Indigenous sovereignty. We are committed to climate action on and off campus, and aspire to question the patriarchal, capitalist, and colonial system that perpetuates climate inaction and ensures that some communities disproportionately feel both the negative impacts of resource extraction industries, and those of climate change.

36.club_name: AMS Colombian Student Association at UBC
36.description: The purpose of this student association is to enrich the presence of Colombian cultural heritage, traditions, and folklore in UBC; the association is open to anyone of the UBC community interested in learning and exploring the unique aspects of this country. We aim to organize and support cultural and social events inspired by Colombian customs and allow members, fellow students, and faculty to get to know each other in the spirit of Colombian culture. ColSA also aims to create spaces of academic discussion and debate that encourage the exchange of ideas about relevant topics related to Colombia’s most urgent realities.

38.description: Welcome to the UBC Comedy Club, where we’re serious about not being serious. Established in 2022, our mission is simple: give campus comedians a place to shine and for aspiring comedians to find their funny bone without the pressure. From open mics to workshops, we create a space where everyone from seasoned pros to first-timers can get on stage, share laughs, and learn the art of comedy. Why do we need a club like this? Because let’s face it, between exams, papers, and group projects, we all need a laugh. Plus, the world is already way too serious, so why not let comedy be our escape? Whether you’re looking to hone your stand-up chops, or just want to crack up from the audience, we’ve got you covered. Oh, and did we mention our year-end showcase? You’ll get to see local and national comedians hit the stage alongside our talented crew, making it a night to remember. So come hang out with us! Whether you’re a comic or a comedy enthusiast, we promise you’ll leave with a smile—or at least a really solid dad joke.

43.description: As UBC's first Development Economics, we aim to advocate for development economics in various ways. Our goal is to provide students with an opportunity to gain a deeper understanding of the ongoing research in development economics and policies. Our events include panel sessions, "DevTalks", fundraisers, debates, and networking events on various topics! Don't forget to follow our Instagram to stay updated!

44.description: Dance Horizons is a student-run, nonprofit organization at UBC that aims to share dance with people of all skill levels and styles. We provide various opportunities to develop technical, performance, and leadership skills in a casual and fun environment. Our classes range from hip-hop to contemporary and are taught by reputable instructors at competitively affordable prices. We aim to broaden the scope of opportunities for dancers through a variety of initiatives (performance groups, volunteer positions, charity) in which members can improve and showcase their skills and talent. Dance Horizons strives to provide the opportunity for students to build a network of passionate and like-minded individuals who are willing to take the initiative to indulge their enthusiasm.

45.club_name: AMS Dermatological Health Association at UBC

46.description: Welcome to the UBC Diabetes Club! Our mission is to raise awareness about diabetes, promote healthy living, and support those affected within the UBC community. We provide educational workshops , free health screenings , and organize fitness activities to encourage a proactive approach to managing and preventing diabetes. Whether you're living with diabetes, interested in learning more, or passionate about health and wellness, the UBC Diabetes Club is the perfect place to connect with like-minded individuals and make a positive impact on campus. Join us in empowering our community through knowledge, support, and healthy living!

47.club_name: AMS Disability Support Free Store at UBC

48.description: Welcome to the AMS Disc Golf Club at UBC! We're all about building a vibrant, community-focused group where fun, friendship, and physical well-being come together. Our club is the perfect place for students to unwind, enjoy disc golf, and make new connections. Whether you're a beginner eager to learn or an advanced player looking to compete at the highest level, we’ve got something for you! Join us for a mix of casual and competitive events, embrace the beauty of Vancouver’s parks, and connect with fellow students in a welcoming and supportive environment.

50.description: We are a club focused on fundraising efforts for various charitable organizations. Our club is not limited to any single organization, we hold events to help various different charities. Club members may even suggest an organization they would like to support at our meetings. Through this, UBC ECHO provides opportunities to plan events and volunteer.

52.club_name: AMS Egyptian Student Association (ESA) at UBC
52.description: The ESA aims to create a community for Egyptian students to embrace their culture while integrating into Western society. We showcase the Egyptian culture, both ancient and modern, to the wider UBC community. The Egyptian Student Association will help keep Egyptian alumni connected with UBC, as they will always be invited to attend our events and stay in touch with the students.

54.description: Our aim is to educate students about eating disorders and promote a positive connection with food. As students, we face challenges like limited resources for healthy meals and time constraints on proper nutrition. Moreover, societal pressures, especially through social media, can lead to unhealthy relationships with food and even eating disorders, negatively impacting our quality of life. As a club, our mission is to break this cycle and guide students towards food freedom. We strive to offer support and resources for students to guide them to develop a healthy relationship with food and exercise by preventing the development of harmful eating patterns.

58.club_name: AMS Figure Skating Club at UBC
58.description: Welcome to the official website of UBC Figure Skating Club. Our club's mission is to provide a community for skaters and skating enthusiasts alike, and to organize athletic and social events to encourage the general student body to get involved with the sport we are so passionate about!

59.club_name: AMS Fijian Students Association at UBC
59.description: Bula UBC! Welcome to the Fijian Student Association at the University of British Columbia. We are here to demonstrate the vibrant culture of Fiji that we can't wait to showcase all UBC students and FJSA members. We are here to help build a community for all Fijian and educate those who are interested to learn about Fijian culture.

61.club_name: AMS Foreign Policy Association at UBC

62.description: We are a student run video game development club aiming to give students a hands-on approach in making video games and provide the tools needed to learn more about the industry. At UBC Game Development, we host a variety of workshops, invite industry guest-speakers and hold regular meetings to help educate our members. We aim to give them the tools and knowledge to succeed in the art of video game development.

63.description: Girls in STEAM aims to support and facilitate access to STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art & Design, Maths) education for girls, women, gender-diverse people, and the LGBTQ+ community. Our main objective is to bridge the gender and diversity gap in STEAM fields by offering a supportive environment that encourages exploration, learning, and professional development. Through a series of regular programming (i.e. workshops and panels), Girls in STEAM hopes to provide underrepresented groups with opportunities to explore the wide range of STEAM topics. By participating in these events, members can gain hands-on experience, develop professional skills, and broaden their understanding of the multidisciplinary nature of the STEAM industry. Girls in STEAM hopes to prepare its members with the necessary tools and knowledge to kick-start their early careers. Our club offers resources and workshops that assist members in strengthening their communication and problem-solving abilities, ultimately empowering them to thrive in the industry. With a focus on promoting access to STEAM resources for girls, women, gender-diverse people, and the LGBTQ+ community, Girls in STEAM strives to foster an inclusive and collaborative society, where diverse perspectives and talents are celebrated and innovation can thrive.

65.club_name: AMS Greek Student Association (GreekSA) at UBC
65.description: The UBC Greek Student Association (GREEKSA) is the newly-created Greek student club, and the only cultural club representing Greeks at UBC. Our mission at GREEKSA is to foster a vibrant and inclusive community for Greek students while extending an open invitation to everyone interested in exploring and embracing Greek culture! We hope to host events that provide Greek students with a supportive network of individuals, helping them to ease their transition into university life, maintain their connection to their heritage, and encourage them to share their unique experiences with others. On the other hand, non-Greek students will be able to learn about a different culture through food, music, dance and truly discover the Greek way!

66.club_name: AMS Health and Society Student Club at UBC
66.description: Welcome to UBC HESO! If you have a keen interest in areas such as Psychology, Sociology, Population and Public Health, Nursing, Anthropology, Food, Nutrition and Health, History, or Social Work, then this club is for you. Our goal is to connect individuals who are passionate about Health and Society, whether or not they are pursuing the HESO minor. We focus on exploring critical public health challenges through a multidisciplinary perspective. This includes examining cultural representations of health, health beliefs and behaviors, health inequalities, and the social determinants of health. Our club offers valuable opportunities to engage with professors, professionals, and peers who share your interests. If you’re enthusiastic about public health and want to connect with a community of like-minded individuals, join us and be part of this dynamic and supportive network!

68.description: The goal of our club is to build a welcoming community that embraces and supports self-identifying women throughout their journey in the gym and engaging with the fitness world regardless of experience level, pronouns or background. Our main focus will be creating opportunities for members to work out together and receive fitness guidance by our certified personal trainers (CPT). Our trainers will provide free, personalized, science-based training to help members build strength, confidence and resilience. We do this through frequent CPT led workshops, social media, a workout buddy program and a novel fitness podcast for UBC students. We aim to leverage our social media presence and go beyond the physical confines of the gym to provide fitness-related information and debunk common misconceptions women may have. Through the fitness podcast, we aim to reach a larger audience of UBC students, sharing the experiences of guest speakers (UBC students and faculty) and dissecting new topics in the fitness field. The revolutionary fitness experience we cultivate allows women to form connections, find support, and stay motivated throughout their journeys.

69.description: UBC Hindu Yuva, where the latter ‘Yuva’ is a double entendre standing for “Youth” in the Indian native language, and “Youth for Unity, Virtue, and Action”(YUVA) in its comfortable acronym form, is what constitutes the core of this club. The mission of the Hindu YUVA as a club is to bring together both Hindu and non-Hindu students alike to raise awareness about Sanātana Dharma and to preserve our cultural and moral traditions. As one of the largest and oldest religions in the world, we believe it is necessary that there be an organization on campus to represent the interests of the Hindu community present here. UBC Hindu Yuva strives to bring Hindu traditions, cultural activities and more for the welfare of the people to UBC in a more appropriate and authentic manner. There are more than 80 chapters of Hindu YUVA all across North America. We represent the first chapter in Canada constituted in 2017 at the University of British Columbia. We hold immense pride in touching more than thousands of students each year uplifting them physically, mentally, emotionally, and spiritually through our events We have organized a diverse array of events including Ganesh Chaturthi, Janamashtami, Raksha Bandhan, Diwali, Navratri, Yoga workshops, Mindfulness guest lecture, Games Night, Movie Night, Garba Workshops, Mehendi Night, Karaoke Night, Bhavagad Gita discourse and many more events you can imagine. We aim to build a community strongly upholding the values of Sanātan Dharma.

71.club_name: AMS Hui O Hawai'i at UBC
71.description: The purpose of the AMS Hui ‘O Hawai‘i at UBC is to foster a vibrant community that celebrates and promotes the rich culture, traditions, and heritage of the Hawaiian Islands. Through our activities and events, we aim to provide an immersive and educational experience for members of all backgrounds. Specifically, our club seeks to achieve the following objectives: Community Building: We aim to create a welcoming and inclusive environment where individuals with a shared interest in Hawai‘i can connect and form meaningful relationships. The club will serve as a platform for students from Hawai‘i, as well as those interested in Hawaiian culture, to build a supportive network and establish a sense of belonging. Cultural Preservation: We strive to preserve and showcase the diverse aspects of Hawaiian culture, including language, music, dance, art, and history. Education and Awareness: We aim to provide educational opportunities to deepen our members' understanding of Hawaiian culture and history. By focusing on these specific objectives, the AMS Hui ‘O Hawai‘i at UBC will serve as a cultural hub that not only enriches the lives of its members but also promotes diversity, fosters cross-cultural understanding, and creates a lasting impact in our community.

72.club_name: AMS Humanities in Healthcare at UBC
72.description: Our club aims to foster a future of healthcare professionals who think critically about the psychosocial determinants of health. This year, we are especially focused on diversity and inclusion. We aim to collaborate with and amplify the voices of marginalized patients, students, and healthcare professionals to: a) identify barriers to healthcare for these communities; b) discuss actionable changes to improve our local healthcare systems; and c) empower individuals from various backgrounds with knowledge, opportunities, and networks to support their pursuit of careers in healthcare.

73.description: ﷽ "O believers, give of what We have provided for you." [2:254] At Islamic Relief UBC, we turn faith into action. As a student-led chapter of Islamic Relief Canada, we empower the UBC and local communities through volunteering, fundraising, outreach, and advocacy, striving to raise awareness about global and local humanitarian issues. Guided by the values of social justice, custodianship, sincerity, and excellence, we provide relief, sponsor orphans, and create lasting impact for families and communities worldwide. Our impact extends locally, by uniting the UBC community through student-led initiatives and collaborations, including volunteer service in Vancouver’s Downtown Eastside, and globally, by contributing to humanitarian relief efforts such as our annual end-of-year fundraising dinner that sponsors orphans worldwide. We remain committed to building a welcoming space where service and inclusivity come together, inspiring students to stand in solidarity with those in need on campus, in Vancouver, and across the world. We provide opportunities where students can give back, develop their skills, and advocate for those who cannot advocate for themselves. Join us in our efforts by standing up for those in need, raising your voice for the voiceless, and fostering positive change, both on campus and around the world!

74.club_name: AMS Ice Cream Club at UBC
74.description: Welcome to the Ice Cream Club, where every scoop brings us closer together! At our university, we believe that life is sweeter when shared with friends. Join us for a delightful mix of fun and relaxation as we indulge in our favorite frozen treats while enjoying social events, game nights, and ice cream tastings. Whether you’re a die-hard ice cream lover or just looking to unwind and meet new people, our club is the perfect place to chill out and savor the joys of life—one scoop at a time!

75.club_name: AMS Indigenous Business Association at UBC
75.description: The AMS Indigenous Business Association (IBA) at UBC is a club dedicated to helping both Indigenous and non-Indigenous students expand their networks, participate in unique events, and support the Indigenous business community. IBA's core mission is to advance economic reconciliation and reduce the challenges faced by Indigenous peoples. It strives to empower students in their academic and career paths by fostering meaningful connections and creating a supportive community that promotes friendship, growth, and development through various events and workshops.

76.description: Established in 2017, Innovation Onboard (IOB) is a Canada-wide student-led initiative that fosters entrepreneurship and interdisciplinary collaboration among science , engineering , and business students. This 6-month program includes 10 workshops, lectures, an innovation fair, and a pitch competition with cash prizes.

77.club_name: AMS InterVarsity Christian Fellowship at UBC
77.description: Welcome to InterVarsity Campus Ministry at University of British Columbia! We're a community on campus that inspires and equips students to encounter Jesus, cultivate Christ-centred faith, and radiate the transforming love of God in Canada and the world. We do that through weekly Bible studies, campus outreach, social gatherings and retreats, all of which are open to all. We have programs for undergraduate students, graduate students and international students. So whoever you are, come on out!

78.description: Welcome to the UBC Jain Students Association, a vibrant cultural and social club where students come together to celebrate values, connect with Indian culture, and meet new people. At UBC JSA, we focus on building a close-knit community through fun social events, cultural festivities, and engaging discussions ranging from values like non-violence and compassion, to thing beyond such as professional development. Whether it's through festivals, dinners, or community service activities, we provide a welcoming space for all students from diverse backgrounds, to explore their cultural roots, make friends, and experience the rich blend of Indian and UBC culture in a fun, inclusive, and social environment. Everyone is welcome—join us and be part of the UBC JSA fam! Despite official Fall hiring closing at the end of September 2024, we're always looking for dynamic new additions to the team. If you're interested in joining us in any capacity or learning more about the team and what we do, please email us or reach out to us on our instagram and we'd be happy to chat :)

80.club_name: AMS Knitting & Sewing Club at UBC
80.description: Welcome to UBC Knit & Sew! We are a club that strives to build a stress-free, fun environment for all yarn and needle crafters. Whether you're a seasoned knitter, a beginner crocheter, or someone who just wants to pick up a new hobby, we've got the place for you! Anyone of any skill level is able to join our club to learn, teach, or be in the company of the fibre arts community. We also provide sewing machine rentals!

81.description: The AMS Kurdish Club at UBC offers a welcoming space for Kurdish students to connect, build meaningful relationships, and foster a sense of community on campus, while celebrating Kurdish culture and traditions. Additionally, the club is dedicated to raising awareness about Kurdish history, the challenges Kurds have faced, and the ongoing struggle for justice. We warmly invite students from all backgrounds to join us in celebrating and learning about Kurdish culture!

82.club_name: AMS Latino Leaders Association at UBC

84.club_name: AMS Love Your Neighbour Club @ UBC
84.description: AMS Love Your Neighbour Club @ UBC is a student-led volunteering group with the purpose of serving the community. We provide volunteering and skills development opportunities for UBC students. Students who desire to make a difference and sharpen their skills will benefit from joining the club. We aim to create and build a safe and welcoming environment for us to love, care and share.

86.description: Awareness, education, and support. At MUO, we aim to shed light on the prevalence and importance of pediatric health issues in Canada to stimulate conversations about enhanced care and support for our vulnerable youth. With a specialized focus on the existence and challenges of numerous pediatric diseases, we are committed to inspiring a mindset of acceptance and action to best accommodate our young loved ones. As a small family of child-caring individuals within the broader UBC community, we strive to unite students with a common interest in pediatric diseases and aiming efforts towards improving the lives of pediatric patients.

87.description: UBC Keralam is dedicated to fostering a sense of community and belonging among students of Kerala origin and those interested in our beautiful state's culture. Our mission is to provide a platform for students to connect, learn, and share their love for Kerala through various cultural, educational, and social events. We believe in creating an inclusive and diverse community at UBC while showcasing the uniqueness of Kerala's heritage. We organize various events throughout the academic year to achieve our goals and create memorable experiences for our members. These events include cultural festivals, traditional dance performances, culinary delights through Onam and Annual Day, and multiple Chaya and movie nights. These events create a comfortable atmosphere for all our members and those who are open to experiencing the Malayali culture. We invite any and all to be part of our UBC Keralam family!

88.club_name: AMS Marvel Student Association Club at UBC

89.club_name: AMS Materials Engineering Graduate Student Association (MTRL GSA) at UBC

90.description: The AMS Medical Ethics Club @ UBC provides a platform for students to explore and discuss relevant topics in medical ethics, fostering critical thinking and ethical reasoning. Our award-winning club, recognized as ‘Best New Club’ at the 2024 AMS Awards Gala, prepares students to navigate ethical challenges in healthcare through discussions, debates, case competitions, and guest speakers. Open to all faculties, we aim to connect like-minded individuals while encouraging diverse perspectives on controversial issues. Whether you're pursuing a career in healthcare or simply passionate about ethics, the AMS Medical Ethics Club @ UBC welcomes you!

91.description: The purpose of our club is to keep students up to date with genetic research advancements, help identify interesting genetics courses, potential research supervisors, potential graduate programs, and educate on bioethical issues related to genetic screening, gene therapy and human genetic engineering. We also strive to foster a sense of community and facilitate connections among students who are passionate about genetics. In the past, some events we’ve held included a Science Trivia Night for Charity, Grad Student Night, National Undergraduate Genetics Symposium (NUGS), and more! By connecting interested undergraduate members with graduate students and research opportunities, we wish to better prepare them for their future academic careers. Want to learn more about the club?: https://linktr.ee/MedicalGenetics To join as a member, please fill out the 2024/25 membership form that is linked in our Linktree!

92.club_name: AMS Medical Imaging Club at UBC
92.description: The main purpose of the Medical Imaging Club is to expose undergraduate students to medical imaging and generate interest in various career paths within this field. We will be working with resident doctors from the British Columbia Radiological Society to achieve the following objectives: 1. Provide educational opportunities, such as workshops and guest lectures, to expose undergraduate students to medical imaging (e.g. imaging modalities, career paths, research), 2: Garner interest amongst students in pursuing careers in medicine as a radiologist or nuclear medicine physician by facilitating interactions with physicians through means such as lectures or shadowing (for undergraduate medical students), 3. Address the shortage of medical imaging technicians in BC by highlighting educational pathways, training programs, and job prospects to increase interest amongst students in pursuing careers as technicians (X-ray, CT, ultrasound, MRI), 4. Promote research (fundamental sciences and clinical) associated with medical imaging by discussing and connecting students with ongoing projects and mentorship opportunities.

93.club_name: AMS Middle East Indian Students' Association at UBC
93.instagram_handle: Middle East Indian Students' Association at UBC
93.description: The Middle East Indian Students Association (MEISA) is all about creating a vibrant, welcoming community where students can connect, celebrate their heritage, and thrive together. We focus on promoting and preserving the rich cultures of India and the Middle East, fostering a sense of belonging for those who want to share in this cultural journey. MEISA is also committed to supporting new students as they transition into life at UBC, offering a platform for building friendships, sharing experiences, and developing leadership skills through participation in cultural events. We're excited to unite people, share stories, and make UBC feel like home for everyone!

94.club_name: AMS Mindfulness Meditation Community at UBC
94.description: The Meditation Community at UBC hosts bi-weekly group meditation and mindfulness sessions aimed to support your growing practice. Whether you are a complete beginner or have a seasoned practice, all are welcome to join us every other Thursday in the Nest room 2508 from 5:30-6:30 PM. Our first event being on October 3rd. We hope to breathe, connect and grow with you soon.

95.description: The AMS Minecraft Club (also known as UBCMC) is the perfect place for those who may be playing, have played, or want to play Minecraft with a vibrant and exciting community! We host monthly events such as Building Competitions, PvP, Survival, Game Nights, you name it. We also run 24/7 Vanilla and Modded servers, with constant upkeep to make sure that your gameplay experience will be constantly fresh and exciting! In 2024 alone, we have ran/are currently running the following: Two Vanilla+ servers, one with datapacks and one with plugins A modded server, running the BigChadGuys Plus Modpack Capture the Flag events on Custom Worlds Two Building Competitions PvE-themed Survival events Countless Game Nights … and much more! In addition, we are also partnered with 2CML, the Cross-Collegiate Minecraft League. They have ran both custom and infamous events such as Survival Games, Lava Rising, Interplanetary Bingo, and Bedwars tournaments. We have also raised over $2,500 to charity while participating in the 2024 Spud Showdown, with MrTechnodad present. In each event, we have had representation from our school against others from North America, Europe, and Asia! Check out our Discord by clicking the "Join Club" button now, or there's a button to our Discord server on the bottom left!

96.description: The purpose of the Modeling Club at UBC is to provide students with a supportive and educational platform to explore the art and skills of modeling. Our club is dedicated to promoting self-confidence, self-expression, and body positivity by teaching the fundamentals of modeling techniques, body postures, and runway skills. Through workshops, photo shoots, runway training, and expert guidance, we aim to instill self-confidence, body positivity, and professionalism in our members to excel in the modeling world, whether as a hobby or potentially as a career path. Our club fosters a welcoming and inclusive community, where students from all backgrounds can come together to learn and grow. We strive to instill the values of self-assurance and self-esteem, emphasizing that beauty is diverse and unique to each individual. By offering a space for creative expression and personal development, we hope to empower our members to embrace their authentic selves and feel comfortable in their own skin.

97.description: We are based on the belief that Muaythai is not just a self-defence combat sport – it is a journey towards building character and confidence alongside your fellow students. No matter what your reason for training is, we hope you form close and supportive bonds as you practice the art of Muaythai. Ultimately, our goal is to build a community like no other and help contribute to your unique university experience!

98.club_name: AMS Music Production Club at UBC
98.description: Our mission is to provide a supportive and creative environment where music enthusiasts can explore, develop, and refine their musical talents. We aim to serve as an entry point for students interested in music production by offering a range of comprehensive educational classes, workshops, and resources designed to enhance their technical skills and knowledge. We strive to foster a vibrant and inclusive community where members can connect, share ideas, and collaborate on musical projects, promoting creativity and artistic expression. Additionally, we advocate for the interests and passions of music lovers within the university, representing their voices in interactions with university organizations and contributing to the broader cultural and artistic landscape of our institution.

99.club_name: AMS Music for Mental Health at UBC
99.description: About Us Music for Mental Health (MMH) is a Canadian youth-led non-profit dedicated to raising awareness for mental health through music creation. We encourage discussion surrounding mental health by promoting artistic self-expression in creating and collaborating on original music. Our goal is to create a network of musicians, mental health enthusiasts, professionals, and community members in using music as a way to share experiences with mental health, in addition to taking on musical projects ourselves to shed light on underrepresented or stigmatized mental health needs in the community.

101.club_name: AMS Myanmar Student Club at UBC
101.description: Mingalabar UBC! Myanmar Student Club is a student organization dedicated to representing the rich cultural heritage of Myanmar (Burma) at UBC. Our club is a hub for students from Myanmar and those interested in our culture to come together, share experiences, and celebrate our traditions. Whether you're looking to connect with fellow Myanmar students, explore Burmese culture, or participate in fun and exciting events, our club is your gateway to a supportive and dynamic community at UBC. Join us to make new friends, learn, and create unforgettable experiences during your time at UBC! Sign up for membership here .

102.club_name: AMS Nepalese Student Association at UBC

103.description: AMS Netball Club @ UBC provides a space for all skill levels of netball players to learn, play, and enjoy netball! Events include: Weekly Practice sessions (including coaching) Competitive Tournaments with external netball clubs in BC Free SRC Drop-Ins and more!!

104.description: Start your product journey here. UBC first and only Product Management club!

105.description: The UBC Paint Club is a club for artists of all experience levels who love to paint and draw! We run weekly art sessions as well as occasionally host art workshops. To stay up-to-date on all our events and club info, follow us on Instagram!

106.club_name: AMS Peruvian Student Association at UBC

107.description: The UBC Physics Society (Physsoc) is a club for people who study physics, who enjoy physics, or who just want a cool place to spend their time with good company. We have tutoring and sell exam packages for first and second year physics classes, run a physics lecture series and mentorship program for undergrads, hold review sessions for courses, Python, and LaTeX, and maintain a private tutor list . We put together various social events for people to wind down and mingle with other students, faculty and staff in the Physics & Astronomy department. We also run our very own Discord server , open to everyone, started by the 2020 council .

108.description: Pick Up UBC is a student-led environmental club at the University of British Columbia dedicated to maintaining a clean and sustainable campus. Through regular clean-up initiatives, we work to prevent litter from entering nearby oceans and forests, where it can take centuries to decompose and cause lasting harm to ecosystems. Our goal is to confront the issue of improper waste disposal on campus while fostering a culture of sustainability, accountability, and care for the environment. We believe that small, consistent actions can inspire broader change. By joining Pick Up UBC, students have the opportunity to contribute to meaningful environmental action while connecting with peers who share a commitment to positive change. All members of the UBC community are welcome to participate, whether you are deeply passionate about sustainability or simply wish to lend a hand in keeping our campus clean.

110.description: Building a fun, inclusive community, while spreading the game of poker to all students.

111.description: The UBC Pre-Dental Club provides guidance to students pursuing the dental field and provides a pre-dental network that students can rely on. We host weekly meetings on Wednesdays at 6:00 pm in IKB 261 and each meeting focuses on a specific stage of applying for dental schools and becoming a competitive applicant. This includes going over the application process of various Canadian dental schools, with very specific details for UBC’s faculty of dentistry. We also go over the DAT, PAT, MMI, and SGI, all the steps that each applicant needs to successfully complete to get into the majority of dental schools. We have speakers from organizations that provide resources and discount codes to our members, such as DAT Crusher, DAT Bootcamp, and OzTREKK. We host monthly socials and term events to build a sense of community for our members where they will have the opportunity to network and meet others with the same aspirations. We have panels where we are joined by dental professionals and dental students who share their journeys and answer the various questions our members have.  Our club also strives to fortify and expand our connections with our local community by opening up volunteer and leadership positions for our members and collaborating with other local organizations. To become a member please visit our Instagram @ubcpredent or email us at ubcpredent@gmail.com for steps to purchase a membership!

115.club_name: AMS Shito-Ryu Sato-Kai Karate Club at UBC

116.description: The UBC Shooting Sports Club is dedicated to making shooting sports accessible to students across the UBC campus and the Lower Mainland. The team is focused on organizing events and engaging with the student community to promote safe and informative shooting experiences. Our primary mission is to provide quality, safe, and educational shooting opportunities to students at the lowest possible cost. By reducing financial barriers, we aim to increase participation and support for shooting sports among young people, ensuring the future growth of the sport and industry.

119.club_name: AMS Socialist Fightback Students at UBC

120.club_name: AMS Spinal Cord Injury Association at UBC

122.club_name: AMS Sports Car Club at UBC
122.description: Thank you for showing interest in UBC Sports Car Club! We hope to bring the car community here at UBC together and host various events such as car meets, cruises, racing sim nights, autocross days, and many more! And no, you don’t need a car to join. Feel free to reach out to our instagram with additional questions :)

123.description: Welcome to the UBC Squash Club! Founded this year in 2024, this is your gateway to a vibrant community of squash enthusiasts at the University of British Columbia. Whether you're a seasoned player or just picking up a racquet for the first time, our club offers a welcoming environment for all skill levels! Join us for our weekly drop-in sessions for club members, where you can sharpen your skills, meet fellow players, and enjoy the thrill of squash.

125.description: UBC Strings club is a student-led music community that aims to provide an inclusive environment for string players of all levels.

127.club_name: AMS Students of the Caribbean (SOCA) at UBC
127.description: SOCA aims to create a vibrant community celebrating the rich cultures that make up the Caribbean!

128.club_name: AMS Sudanese Students Union at UBC

129.description: Howdy, swimmers! We are the UBC AMS Swim Club! We practice 3 times a week at the UBC Aquatic Centre: Mondays 8:30-9:30PM, and Tuesday/Thursdays 7-8PM. Membership fees are $75 per semester, or $130 for the Sept 2025 - April 2026 year. We offer three levels at each practice: Gold, Silver, and Blue. Gold and Silver are for more experienced swimmers, with practices styled like competitive practices, but with less intensity. Blue is designed for those with no formal swimming experience, with goals to improve your swimming abilities and techniques with the help of our coaches! Our only requirement is that you must be able to swim 50m without stopping. (see our instagram page for sample practices and additional information) In addition to swimming, we make sure that this is a social club too! We host a few socials each semester, from going to hockey games together to hosting pizza-fueled trivia nights after practice. This is a one-stop-shop for both friends and fitness! This club is home to many new swimmers who are looking for a welcoming place to start, and plenty of ex-competitive swimmers who want to keep swimming routinely in University. We'd love to welcome all of you to our club. See you on deck!

130.club_name: AMS Taoist Practitioner Club at UBC

131.club_name: AMS Taylor Swift Club at UBC

132.club_name: AMS Tea Ceremony Club at UBC

137.description: The UBC Transplant Club is dedicated to raising awareness, expanding the donor pool, and fundraising for charitable initiatives related to organ and tissue transplantation. Our goal is to create a supportive community that serves as a platform for education, advocacy, and outreach within UBC and the broader community. We aim to educate the UBC community and the public about the critical need for donors and the life-saving impact of transplants. By organizing information campaigns, outreach events, and partnerships with local organizations such as BC Transplant, we will encourage more individuals to register as donors, potentially saving countless lives. Additionally, we are committed to providing emotional and informational support to transplant recipients, donors, and their families, recognizing the challenges they face. Through our efforts, we hope to make a lasting impact in the field of transplantation while fostering a culture of compassion and solidarity among UBC students and the wider community.

138.club_name: AMS Turkish Student Association at UBC

140.description: Quantum technology, especially quantum information and quantum computing, will shape our future. Though still in its infancy, quantum computing is well-positioned for high-impact applications in drug and material discovery, finance, cryptography, and the like. It is more important now than ever for the UBC student community to engage in the learning and solving of quantum computing problems. We provide hands-on workshops and 1-on-1 mentorship to help students navigate available resources (with a focus on application), explore their interests, and accelerate their abilities in quantum computing. Peer-facilitated learning and co-working sessions are organized to support members in developing their own projects in quantum computing (albeit for fun or for future aspirations). We partner with companies, organizations, and research institutes to host seminars and industry nights to expose members to field-leading research and employment opportunities. We strive to cultivate an equitable and diverse future quantum workforce, today! If you are interested, please feel free to reach out - we would love to discuss what UBC Quantum Club can do for you!

142.description: Welcome to UBC Taekwondo! Whether you're a "retired" black belt, actively training for your next belt, have no idea what Taekwondo is, or are just looking for something fun between lectures, this is the club for you! As one of the largest martial arts clubs at UBC, we pride ourselves on building an inclusive and supportive community through the traditional Korean martial art of Taekwondo. Through our weekly classes, we aim to help you build a foundation in Taekwondo, self defence, and fitness, as well as foster a fun social environment to build lasting friendships. If you're looking to enter the world of Taekwondo, reconnect with it, or continue to further your journey, consider checking us out!

143.club_name: AMS UBC Taiwan Association at UBC
143.description: UBCTA (Taiwan Association) is a cultural club and beyond. Our Philosophy is to be Taiwanese (and more) students’ second home. For this, we hold events monthly starting in July, in Taiwan, also with North America International Student Alliance in Taiwan. Through this, we provide assistance for international Taiwanese students coming to BC and make them feel less alone before stepping on the journey of studying abroad. In UBC, we collaborate with other cultural clubs, and aim to promote Asian culture together. Beyond the UBC community, to the greater Vancouver community, we often connect with other associations like SFU Taiwan Association; government organizations like Taipei Economic and Cultural Office, and Metro Vancouver Overseas Taiwanese. Being a historical club at UBC, we trace our heritage and often meet with club execs from the 1990s, whom many are now members of Metro Vancouver Taiwan Professional Elite, and we provide much job-related information in various industries for our members. Acknowledging our privilege of studying at UBC, we give back to Taiwanese and Canadian society by holding UBC application info sessions for immigration school kids, also sharing our experiences in National Taiwan University.

145.club_name: AMS Ukrainian Student Union at UBC
145.description: Welcoming space at The University of British Columbia where students share Ukrainian identity, culture, and history #TheWarIsNotOver

146.club_name: AMS Unlimited Dance Club at UBC (UDC)
146.description: Unlimited Dance Club (UDC) is a street dance club at UBC! We offer weekly drop-ins for all things street style, like popping, locking, hip hop, and even breakdancing! We also organize icebreakers, club performances, and more! Make sure to check out are instagram for all the latest updates!

147.club_name: AMS Visual Art Students Association at UBC

149.club_name: AMS Wing Chun Club at UBC
149.description: Welcome to the AMS Wing Chun Club at UBC! We are practicing Wing Chun on Mondays and Thursdays from 7-9PM at LIFE5 in the Life Building.

150.description: We are a student-led organization dedicated to uplifting self-identifying women in all aspects of life. Our club hosts monthly events , a bi-weekly book club , monthly podcast episodes , and fundraisers throughout the year ! With a membership fee of just $3 for the entire year, we aim to foster a vibrant, supportive community. Our Goals: Create a safe and inclusive space for self-identifying women, 2SLGBTQIA+, gender non-conforming people, and their allies at UBC. Advocate for gender equity in today’s society. Promote intersectionality in feminism through education and conversation. Raise awareness and support for local women-led and women-supporting organizations . To join our club, please press the join button on our site and fill out the google form! Then please e-transer $3 to our treasurer, at miyacreeden@gmail.com . Please include a note in the e-transfer that says "WEC Membership" Join us in creating a space where everyone can thrive and grow together!

151.club_name: AMS Women in Economics and Policy @ UBC

152.description: This year, the WISp team is looking forward to building a community of women's sports enthusiasts through fun events, tournaments and more! Join us for beginner friendly sports events and drop in activities throughout the year!

153.description: Our mission is to provide an empowering and intrepid community for female-identifying students at UBC. We wish to create a fun, safe, and respectful environment that encourages, and nurtures health-aligned goals. The entry into a healthy and active lifestyle is challenged by numerous factors not limited to intimidation, fear, and uncertainty. These challenges can become even more daunting when faced with prejudice against gender, queerness, and religion. Therefore, the purpose of the AMS Women’s Health Club is to provide a safe, accessible space to support, encourage, and hype-up female-identifying students as they pursue their health and fitness-related goals. We believe in helping every woman learn and develop a healthy lifestyle that aligns with their personal goals to help them live a balanced lifestyle as they take on challenges to reach their fullest personal and professional potential. We aim to bring together and support female-identifying students from all fields of study at UBC to improve our member’s wellness through group fitness classes, networking socials and awareness events.

154.club_name: AMS Women's Health Research Club at UBC

155.club_name: AMS Women's Reproductive Health Project @ UBC

156.description: Women's Health Project UBC is an initiative focusing on spreading awareness about women's health and raising money for underprivileged women locally and globally.

158.description: Who​ ​are​ ​we ?​ We are a group of female-identifying UBC students from different STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) fields committed to being role models for the next generation and to making a difference in our community. Our main goal is to reduce the gender gap by inspiring more young people, especially girls, to pursue careers in STEM fields.

159.description: AMS unboundED @ UBC is a student-run club that provides Science and Arts workshops to elementary schools and daycares to invoke curiosity and excitement to help reduce the uncertainty when choosing their field of study or career path. Join us and volunteer with helping out the community by aiding the younger generation with any questions they might have about potential areas of study!

162.description: We create inclusive communities for a more peaceful world by developing leaders , fostering friendship among members, and rendering service to all. APO UBC is the first Canadian chapter of Alpha Phi Omega, a National Collegiate Service-based leadership development organization. Alpha Phi Omega is the largest gender-inclusive service organization in the United States and Canada. Since 1925, more than 525,000 members on over 375 campuses have continued to provide more service than any other collegiate service organization. Alpha Phi Omega teaches through the principles of Leadership, Friendship, and Service that we are the architects of our own ambitions, with the opportunity to develop ourselves into whatever we aspire to be. Alpha Phi Omega offers members opportunities to engage in leadership development, service, and fellowship. We recognize that our Cardinal Principles of Leadership, Friendship, and Service are not only equal but integral to a comprehensive fraternity experience. These principles develop our members in community-focused, interconnected, and holistic ways, benefiting them throughout their lives. This is the unique value of membership in Alpha Phi Omega.

163.description: Amnesty International UBC is an AMS club that promotes awareness of human rights around the UBC campus and the Vancouver community.  We focus on letter-writing campaigns and fostering community knowledge and dialogue. Once you join the club via CampusBase, you must also fill out this form, and pay a one-time membership fee to be considered a member and to attend our events: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfxcBcZP5O0itsmtcU4EOv3Yn3UnZ_achsdFo31KnRFmnA7WA/viewform We are guided by the mandate of Amnesty International to uphold universal standards of human rights and equality and to promote a peaceful and impartial voice for the oppressed and wrongfully treated.  If you wish to participate in our organization, please fill out the membership form linked on our profile and follow us on Instagram to stay updated about upcoming events! You can also join our mailing list to get the latest information on meeting times and the exciting events we hold throughout the year- email our president at amnestyubc@gmail.com!

164.club_name: Ancient Mediterranean and Near Eastern Student Association

169.club_name: Association of Canadian Archivists Student Chapter
169.description: Association of Canadian Archivist UBC Student Chapter (ACA@UBC) is the official student chapter of the national professional association for archivists. The chapter exists to connect students enrolled in the graduate program to the larger professional field and strive to connect the graduate students with the larger archival field through tours and workshops.

170.club_name: Association of Korean Canadian Scientists and Engineers
170.description: Our chapter’s goal is to strengthen the Korean Canadian community within UBC by hosting innovative and welcoming academic and social events, supported by our close-knit executive team. We welcome students from all backgrounds and look forward to meeting all of you!

172.description: We are the branch of BRASA at the University of British Columbia. Our objective is to bring the Brazilian culture to UBC and Vancouver. We hope to cultivate a welcoming community for students, providing resources for networking, socialising and feeling close to home (even if it is many kilometres away). Our club hosts and organises various parties, talks, and social events that incorporate Brazilian culture. Our events attract a diverse, enthusiastic, and open-minded crowd of students. Whether you are Brazilian or just want to learn more about our country and culture, we hope to see you at our events this year!

173.club_name: Bachelor + Masters of Management Students Association

174.club_name: Bachelor of Computer Science Student Association

175.club_name: Bachelor of Pharmaceutical Sciences Student Association
175.description: Welcome to the BPSc Student Association (BSA)! Our club is a student-centered organization focused on planning social and academic events for our student body. Whether it be formal events that give our students the chance to de-stress and mingle with their peers, career-development workshops focused on resume building, or free care packages to help students during busy exam seasons, the BSA provides our student body with diverse experiences to enhance university life.

176.description: UBC Beads & Crafts Club holds bi-weekly workshops where you can make fun DIY jewelry, coffee cozies, phone charms, and more! No skills or tools required: We provide all the materials, instructions, and help needed to make your very own craft creation!

177.description: Friendship is important in the development of all people. For people with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities (IDD), friendship is a medium through which they become active members of the community. Our club offers people with IDD the chance to participate in experiences that most of us take for granted: going for coffee, going to the movies, or just spending time with a friend. Our club helps alleviate loneliness and isolation and builds leadership skills, independence, and confidence through friendships between UBC students and people with IDD in the Vancouver area. Our vision for the future is a world that fosters awareness and inclusion and supports individuals with an Intellectual and/or Developmental Disability (IDD).

178.description: The Biochemistry Student Association (BSA) is a departmental club aiming to help support the unique and diverse needs of undergraduate biochemistry students at UBC. As a club, BSA’s goal is “to meet the unique needs of UBC Biochemistry students and work in conjunction with the biochemistry faculty to foster an inclusive, diverse and vibrant community through social, academic, and professional programming.” Planning socials, selling hoodies, sharing study resources/tips, and letting students know about career and research opportunities are just a few of the things the BSA dose each year. Check out the “Events” tab and follow us on Instagram to keep up to date about upcoming events! Visit the BSA website for up to date executive members, information on the club and biochemistry at UBC! Click the “join” button at top of this page to join our monthly newsletter, or email us at bsa.bioc.ubc@gmail.com

182.description: We are UBC's live music initiative aiming to create a network of connections and resources for music-lovers and music-makers, bridging the gap between UBC and the greater Vancouver local music scene! We emphasize supporting live music by hosting a range of events, from free music shows at Koerners to our annual music festival Goosehunt. We offer opportunities for students to connect with the local creative community, and offers an afforable place to practice their craft in our Jam Space, equipped with a variety of instruments and equipment. As a hub for music lovers, Blank Vinyl Project aims to continue building its community, platform emerging artists, and offer a space for creativity and fun! Check out our instagram for upcoming events!

183.description: Hello! We are Born For More, a Christian club since 1954. Today, our goal is to help the UBC community develop friendships and relationships with Jesus. We would love to chat and answer any questions you have! Whoever you are, Jesus is waiting for you.

187.club_name: Canadian Students for Sensible Drug Policy
187.description: We advocate for sensible drug policy, while on unceded xwməθkwəy̓əm, Skwxwú7mesh, Stó:lō; and Selilwitulh land. We are  a grassroots network of youth (under 30) and students who are concerned with the negative impact of drug policies on individuals and communities. Drug use is a health and human rights issue no a criminal one. And the war on drugs is a white supremacist, colonial, ableist, and classist war on bodily autonomy. We are member led, and the work we do depends on the capacity and interests of those that join our club. We advocate for evidence-based responses to reduce and prevent harms associated with drug use and drug criminalization. Our advocacy is broad and aims to reach beyond the UBC campus with a diversity of tactics and community comrades and partners.

188.description: Hello! We are a Christian Fellowship club for Cantonese speaking students:) We have weekly gatherings on Monday 5-7pm in UBC (location to be updated on our instagram), which we would play games, sing hymns, bible study, share, and pray together. We welcome you to join and hope to see you!

189.description: Catholic Christian Outreach (CCO) is a Catholic movement raising up Christ-centered, spirit-filled leaders to evangelize the world one person at a time. CCO's mission, rooted on university campuses, includes alumni, parishes, dioceses, and other key Church and global partners. ___ Hey and welcome! We are a Catholic community building up leaders for the renewal of the world, the Great Commission Jesus calls us to when He says "Go, make disciples of all nations." We run faith studies each semester, as well as fun community events and adoration nights called 'Summit'. If you'd like to find mass or confession on campus, are curious about Jesus or the Catholic church, or are interested in the club, shoot us an email. God bless!

190.description: Welcome to the AMS Chabad Jewish Student Club at UBC! Our club programming reflects a tolerant, non-judgmental environment, where open dialogue is welcome, and is a hallmark of Chabad's inclusiveness. We run all kinds of events ranging from Shabbat dinners to Jewish Holidays to educational and social events and everything in between. We strive to create a place where every JEW is FAMILY and to make UBC a place that is welcoming for all Jews on campus, a place where Jews of all backgrounds can find community, resources, a smorgasbord of Jewish events and rich opportunities for celebration and study.

191.club_name: Chemical and Biological Engineering Graduate Student Club

192.club_name: Chemical and Biological Engineering Undergraduate Club
192.description: Run by your CHBE undergrads The CHBE Club is a dynamic and inclusive student organization dedicated to fostering a sense of community within the Chemical and Biological Engineering department. Our club provides a wide array of services and events, focusing on student life, academic support, professional development, and social activities. Led by a team of passionate executive members, the club ensures that students have opportunities to connect with their peers, develop professional skills, and engage in extracurricular activities that enhance their university experience. At the heart of the club's operations is the President, who serves as the primary representative and voice, overseeing the overall direction and management of the club. Supporting the President are various Vice-Presidents, each with a specialized role, from enhancing student life through social events and sports, to overseeing the club’s financial health, academic services, communications, and professional development initiatives. Together, the executive team ensures that the club remains a valuable resource for students, promoting engagement, learning, and growth. The CHBE Club also includes elected representatives from each year, who act as liaisons between their respective classes and the club, ensuring that the voices of all students are heard and their needs addressed. Through collaborative efforts, the club strives to build a strong, vibrant engineering community that fosters both academic excellence and personal development.

195.description: Established in 1956, the Chinese Students’ Association (CSA) is the first and longest-standing Chinese student club at UBC. As a non-profit organization, CSA is dedicated to building a vibrant community centred around a passion for Chinese culture. Our mission is to foster connections and friendships among UBC students by showcasing the richness of Chinese heritage through a variety of inclusive sports, cultural, and social events. For 60 years, CSA has established trust and recognition with its community through lasting partnerships with both local and international organizations. Moreover, CSA members enjoy numerous discounts sponsored by partners in the greater Vancouver area. We motivate our members to be engaged in the community and become well-rounded individuals. Our club is inclusive and welcoming to applicants of all experience levels and backgrounds.

196.description: Christian Students at UBC warmly receives all believers in Christ and seeks to maintain the oneness of the Spirit by keeping our focus on Christ. He is so rich! He is so full! He is everything to us, and we enjoy Him. We hold the faith which is common to all the believers (Titus 1:4, Jude 3): The Bible is the complete divine revelation inspired word by word by God through the Holy Spirit (2 Pet. 1:21, 2 Tim. 3:16) God is uniquely one, yet triune — the Father, the Son, and the Spirit (1 Tim. 2:5a, Matt. 28:19) The Son of God, even God Himself, was incarnated to be a man by the name of Jesus Christ (John 1:1, John 1:14) Christ died on the cross for our sins, shedding His blood for our redemption (1 Pet. 2:24, Eph. 1:7a) Christ resurrected from among the dead on the third day (1 Cor. 15:4) Christ ascended to the right hand of God to be Lord of all (Acts 1:9, Acts 2:33, Acts 2:36) Whenever any person repents to God and believes in the Lord Jesus Christ, he is regenerated (born again) and becomes a living member of the one Body of Christ (Acts 20:21, John 3:3, Eph. 1:22-23, Rom. 12:5) Christ is coming again to receive His believers to Himself (1 Thes. 2:19)

199.description: We're the Cognitive Systems Society (CSS), the undergraduate student club for the Cognitive Systems (COGS) program! We connect, support, and celebrate UBC’s COGS community by offering a diverse range of events and opportunities.

200.club_name: Combined Major in Science Student Association

201.description: Welcome to the Computer Science Student Society, the student club for undergraduates at the UBC Department of Computer Science. We provide a social space where everyone is welcome (in ICICS 021), run events, and represent your interests to the department. For more events you may be interested in, please follow us on our social media outlets!

203.description: Creative Industries Network (CIN) provides a space for students passionate about pursuing their creative interests as careers by building a network with industry professionals. Understanding that creative fields are often underrepresented, CIN focuses on using artistic passions along with the business acumen needed to establish and propel a career in their creative industry of interest. CIN aims to transform how students approach their passions by sharing the practical skills and knowledge that students need to succeed in their creative industry of interest as entrepreneurs. Through events, online resources, alumni mentorship, and connections with industry professionals, we aim to equip UBC students with the knowledge and confidence to break into the creative industries. The club started with a focus on four major industries, being Music, Dance, Film and Visual Arts. But we’ve since then diversified our focus to include more industries including Fashion, Beauty, Media, Graphic Design and Theatre and are continuing to highlight other niches of interest. By collaborating with local UBC and Vancouver-based talent, we nurture connections with industry professionals that allow us to develop and share with students the business resources necessary to launch careers in creative industries globally.

204.club_name: Electrical and Computer Engineering Student Society

209.description: The Environmental Sciences Students' Association (ESSA) is a student club representing the Environmental Sciences program at The University of British Columbia. We are dedicated to bringing people together who share a passion for the environment, organizing study sessions and social events for students to get to know each other, hosting alumni nights and career conferences with professionals, and participating in events promoting public awareness of environmental issues. If you’re an ENSC student or have an interest in Environmental Sciences, ESSA is a great way to connect with other students, get involved, and create a unique undergrad experience.

211.club_name: Friends of MSF (Medecins Sans Frontieres) UBC
211.instagram_handle: Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières UBC
211.description: Friends of Médecins Sans Frontières (FoMSF) UBC is a non-profit, student run organization which supports the work of MSF/Doctors Without Borders. There are numerous FoMSF branches all across Canada, including here in BC at the University of British Columbia. We support MSF through our Advocacy and Fundraising commitments and provide a community for students of various disciplines to work for and contribute to global health initiatives. Our advocacy events aim to educate the UBC community on global humanitarian issues, including the work MSF carries out across the world. This is done through boothing, panels, and solidarity walks. We also incorporate advocacy internally by holding bi-weekly global affairs discussions where a member of the team presents a specific MSF assignment and comes up with discussion questions for us to reflect on. Our fundraising events aim to raise funds for the club so that we can continue putting on events as well as raise funds for MSF to support their life saving humanitarian work.

212.club_name: Gado-Gado Indonesian Student Association of UBC

213.club_name: Gender, Race, Sexuality, and Social Justice Undergraduate Society
213.description: The GRSJUA is a student-led organization that exists to work within and amongst the margins. As a club committed to social justice in all its forms, we seek to address the collective and individual needs of marginalized students including, but not limited to: BIPOC, queer, trans, disabled, socioeconomically disadvantaged, immigrant, and alternative folks. We go beyond surface level interactions and prioritize spaces for students to unlearn systems of harm, engage with their emotions, receive tangible support (example: a hot meal), and encounter social justice as a liberatory tool of healing, joy, and resistance. The GRSJUA attempts to encompass social justice in multiple forms—hosting social, academic, peer-support, and mutual aid events, in addition to offering club advocacy for equity initiatives on and off campus.
