We operate from an ethos of radical creativity, imagination, liberation, and joy. We aim to provide an accessible, open and community orientated space for students from all different backgrounds, disciplines and lived experiences to interact with social justice in a meaningful way. The GRSJUA does not charge membership fees, a majority of our events are free, and all students are welcome to join!

214.description: As one of the most active student associations on campus since 1969, the UBC Geography Students’ Association (GSA) is dedicated to delivering a memorable student experience for every facet of university life: academic, professional, and of course, social. Our members enjoy endless opportunities to meet new faces of the community through our social events, academic and professional mentorship program, world-famous BZZR gardens and pub trivia nights, and Bad Latitude intramural teams. Students can also look forward to chances to meet industry professionals at our Career Week events, engaging talks with professors and guest speakers, and the opportunity to platform their research at our Town Hall workshop conference. And that’s not all– we also publish the recognized undergraduate journal Trail Six, run the GeoGarden, and throw a killer end-of-year celebration at Geogala. Because we know every student has a place in the GSA, we invite you to take advantage of our passion for having a great time (with great company!) by joining our community.

216.description: Get Thrifty is UBC's on campus thrift and consignment store, located in the basement of the Life Building. We accept clothing donations anytime the store is open, and offer appointments for consignment.

217.description: As we age, life presents new challenges. At Golden Voices, we understand the unique needs of seniors, especially those with language barriers, and provide solutions focused on each individual to enhance their quality of life. Through various strategies and programs we aim to create more convenient and energetic lives for our seniors who are unfamiliar with English and learn more about other cultures through meaningful relationships.

220.description: Welcome to Hong Kong YOURS! Established in 1997, Hong Kong YOURS Association a subsidiary of the AMS @ the University of British Columbia. Through various social events across the school year, we aim to create a “home away from home” for students from a Hong Kong background. Although many of our members are born and/or raised in Hong Kong, we are a multicultural club and you will find diversity both in our members and in the events that we hold.

221.club_name: Hope to House Awareness Initiative at UBC
221.description: Welcome to UBC Hope to House! Our club is committed to raising awareness about homelessness in Vancouver, and connecting those struggling with homelessness to mental health resources. We strive to give students access to important tools for mitigating the stresses of housing insecurity, tools to search for housing in Vancouver, and opportunities to be a part of change in this city for those that are struggling. We accomplish these goals through research, spreading resources, and facilitating volunteering opportunities. We also host various events on campus so that you can get know other UBC students who share a passion for reducing the stigma about homelessness, increasing awareness about the resources out there, and of course fostering a sense of community! Become a Member! Join us today as a member to gain access to: Priority sign-up access to our volunteer trips! Our members-only Instagram Story with early info, sneak peeks, and advanced polls! Member's pricing/free entry at events and fundraisers! Other membership perks from our partners! We can't wait for you to join us!

224.description: Welcome to IRSA! The International Relations Student Association (IRSA) at the University of British Columbia is a dynamic student-led organization that serves as a hub for those passionate about global affairs, diplomacy, and international issues. As a community of engaged students, we aim to foster academic and professional growth by providing opportunities for dialogue, learning, and networking in the field of international relations. Through speaker events, workshops, conferences, and social activities, IRSA creates an inclusive space for UBC students to explore global topics, connect with like-minded peers, and engage with professionals in the field. Whether you're pursuing a degree in international relations or simply interested in world affairs, IRSA is your platform for meaningful engagement and academic enrichment. Join us in navigating the complexities of the international stage, building leadership skills, and making a global impact!

225.description: Israel On Campus is a club dedicated to promoting peace, democracy, and human rights on campus through advocacy work. Our club is dedicated to combating antisemitism and anti-zionism in all forms on the UBC campus. We strive to promote Israeli culture through educational and social initiatives that highlight Israel's unique traditions and customs, whether through music, food, language, or dance.

226.description: Hey everyone! Welcome to the Italian Student Association! We strive to represent Italians and the Italian culture in the UBC community. We would be thrilled to have you on board for one of our meetings, events or just for a chat! There are no language nor nationality barriers, everyone is welcome! Ciao! Benvenuti all'Italian Student Association! Rappresentiamo gli italiani e la cultura italiana a UBC. Ci farebbe molto piacere se venissi ad uno dei nostri incontri o eventi, o semplicemente per una chiaccherata! Non ci sono requisiti linguistici o di cittadinanza, siamo aperti a tutti!

227.description: We are the UBC/AMS Chapter of Jack.org ! Jack.org is the only national network of young leaders transforming the way we think about mental health. We’re building a community without shame. A country where all young people have the knowledge they need to take care of their own mental health. A Canada where we have the power to change systems so that those who need support access the help they deserve.

229.description: Club Mission Statement: The JSA strives to provide fun and inclusive social, cultural, and educational programming for all Jewish students of Vancouver's Jewish university community. We hope to provide a space for students to connect with Judaism through cultural events and educational projects on campus. The JSA strives to be open to a complete spectrum of Jewish students' opinions and hopes to liaise with any organization that promotes all UBC students' multicultural interests. We strive to promote safety and security to every Jewish student on campus and stand up against antisemitism.

231.club_name: Korean Campus Mission at University of British Columbia (KCM-UBC)
231.description: What Is KOINONIA ? Founded as UBC KCM (Korean Campus Mission) in 2004, we have continued as xolvwvía (Koinonia) since 2010, embodying fellowship in Christ through love and community :) As the only student-led Korean Christian club @UBC, we are a community striving to be: Worshipers focused on praise, Ministers who love and serve according to the Word, Evangelists living Christ-like lives on and off campus.

233.description: The Landscape Architecture Student Association is comprised of elected graduate students from both the Landscape Architecture program and the Dual Degree (MARCLA) program. We aim to improve student life by organizing social and educational events, offering academic opportunities, and connecting students at SALA. We also support students through access to resources and connections to professionals. Visit our website to learn more.

236.description: The UBC Media Studies Student Association is a departmental club for students enrolled in the Bachelor of Media Studies (BMS) program. Our goal is to foster connection within our student body through newsletters, workshops, networking opportunities, and sharing student experience. Throughout the year, MSSA plans various Media Studies-themed events open to all BMS students and, on occasion, Bachelor of Arts students in the Media Studies CAP program. These events are social or educational in nature and are intended to create a tighter-knit community within the program.

237.description: Welcome to the UBC Medical Laboratory Club! This club is supported by UBC's Alma Mater Society (AMS) and wishes to introduce the vast field of Medical Laboratory Sciences to any students who are interested. The Medical Laboratory Club provides information and opportunities to students interested in Medical Laboratories. We hope to help people understand different branches in Medical Laboratories. This club provides an opportunity to network and engage with medical professionals ranging from scientists to doctors. Check out the Instagram page to view upcoming events and opportunities for networking and collecting volunteer hours!

238.description: Welcome! We are creating a community of peer-support, open-discussion, and self-improvement. The 3 ways we do this are our action-focused discussions, active GRIT challenges, and volunteering events! As a member you can also expect to have an opportunity to try new hobbies and activities through our collaborations with other clubs, and chill member social hangouts. If your looking for a community to help you be the best version of yourself, you've come to the right place!

240.description: The Midwifery Students' Association's mission is to connect UBC Midwifery Students socially and academically to create a cohesive student body within the program. We aim to develop interprofessional relationships with other healthcare students at UBC and within the UBC Faculty of Medicine and support an empowered student body within the Midwifery Program and the UBC Faculty of Medicine by increasing communication and acting as a liaison between students and UBC departments.

242.description: Motion UBC is a student-led initiative dedicated to providing pro-bono services to local non-profit organizations. We are a team of programmers and designers who develop software-based solutions to help make a difference in the community. Our mission is to provide an opportunity to use technology as a tool for positive change, as well as providing students with valuable hands-on experience.

243.description: We are MusicBox Children's Charity UBC! We seek to bring music education to children across the Greater Vancouver area - especially to those who face social or economic marginalization. Our club provides opportunities for our volunteers to teach children music. We work with kids ages 3-15, and offer a diverse array of group and individual lessons for different ages! No music experience is required for most of our programs, and we're always happy to welcome new volunteers!

244.description: Welcome to the Muslim Students’ Association of UBC, MSA UBC, your home away from home! Whether you’re looking for a community, spiritual growth, or just a place to unwind, we are here for you. As the main Muslim club and representative of Islam on campus, we offer a variety of events, from enlightening Islamic talks to fun recreational activities. At MSA UBC, we aim to serve Allah SWT by supporting Muslim students, building bridges with the wider community, and sharing the beauty of Islam with people from all walks of life. Guided by the Qur’an, Sunnah, and the wisdom of our scholars, we are dedicated to fulfilling our purpose of worshiping Allah SWT. Join us and be part of a vibrant, welcoming community!

245.description: New Taiwanese Generation is one of the established Taiwanese clubs at UBC. We are a half cultural / half social club, seeking to bring Taiwanese culture to our UBC campus and pushing to break social barriers between individuals. New Taiwanese Generation (NTG) is a Taiwanese cultural club located at the University of British Columbia - Vancouver campus. NTG has been operated by student volunteers and has attracted more than 1000 members since it was established in 1998. At NTG, we strive to help students adjust to university life, make meaningful relationships, and create memorable experiences. We believe that university is not only an opportunity to further your education but also to explore different aspects of the student community. In order to create a platform for students to enjoy university life and build social networks, NTG executives work hard to deliver a variety of events such as Icebreakers, Halloween Event, Game Nights, and Monthly Dine-Outs. Our club offers a welcoming space for new and ongoing student members, who may or may not be interested in Taiwanese culture. Follow our social media for more details! 新新人類 (NTG) 是一個半文化/半社交的台灣社團，在英屬哥倫比亞大學 (UBC) 的這25年中，我們致力於將台灣文化帶進UBC的校園中，並努力縮小人與人之間的社交距離。 新新人類是一個位於英屬哥倫比亞大學溫哥華校區的台灣社團。從 1998年成立後，新新人類在很多學生的用心照料下吸引了一千多位學生的加入 。我們相信大學不僅是一個精進學業的機會，也是拓展人際關係和創造難忘回憶的機會。為了給大家帶來一個充實的大學生活，NTG學生幹部們各個努力籌備各種不同的活動，例如破冰活動、萬聖節活動、遊戲之夜、每月聚餐等。無論你對台灣文化的興趣有多少，是新生還是在校的學生，我們的社團都歡迎你來加入! 欲知更多詳情，歡迎關注我們的 社交媒體賬號 ！

246.description: Welcome to the OTSS! This club is an internal enrollment for UBC Master of Occupational Therapy students. Unfortunately, it is not intended for individuals not enrolled in the program. Executive positions are voted in based on each class of students. Membership is automatic for students enrolled in the program. If you are enrolled in the program please contact your Presidents (MOT2s) that you met during orientation for any questions regarding the society. Thank you.

247.description: PRINT Arts and Crafts Club (standing for PeRsonalized INteresT) aims to provide UBC students with a safe and inclusive environment for students to de-stress and explore their creativity with various practices of art. We are currently celebrating our 14th year at UBC! We are committed to hosting an array of events across various mediums to support students in discovering their personalized interests. Our most popular events are our bi-weekly workshops and socials where members are able to interact with like-minded individuals to create unique crafts to their heart’s content. We also have many unique collaborations with other UBC organizations such as Anime Club, UBC Botany Club, Common Energy and more! PRINT Arts and Crafts club hosts the bi-annual Maker’s Market with 4 other clubs that evolved from our Craft Fair in 2022! We aim to create an accessible and low-barrier platform for student-led/local artists to practice their creative entrepreneurial endeavors through creating and sharing their own art. We hope to continue growing the arts and crafts community here at UBC through various socials, workshops, and markets!

248.club_name: Parkinson's and Alzheimers Targeted Hope and Support

249.description: PCSA is dedicated to supporting current and prospective Pharmacology and CAPS students while fostering a welcoming community around the two programs. The club is devoted to providing guidance, specialization information night, study resources/question packs, and study sessions to aid students in their academic journey. Through interdisciplinary socials and career nights, PCSA establishes a positive community to enrich the UBC experience of our students while setting them up for success beyond their undergraduate degree.

251.description: We are the UBC Philosophy Students' Association! The purpose of our club is to provide a place for the philosophically inclined to discourse on life's biggest questions and the thinkers who attempt to answer them. Add our events to your calendar using this link !

253.description: Who are we? The Planetary Health Club is a brand new club at UBC focusing on the intersection between environmental sustainability and public health! We hope to raise awareness of how climate change and environmental degradation impact human health by promoting sustainable practices within the healthcare sector. What is our goal? To inspire action and drive positive change both within UBC and in the broader healthcare industry. To equip future medical professionals with the knowledge and skills to advocate for and implement environmentally sustainable healthcare practices. To promote sustainable practices within the healthcare sector. Join Our Team! We are currently hiring co-ordinators for our various sub-teams: Marketing Coordinators (1-2) Administration Coordinators (1-2) Education Coordinators (1-2) Initiatives Coordinators (1-2) Outreach Coordinators (1-2) Sponsorship Coordinators (1-2) Fill out the following hiring form if you're interested in joining the team: https://forms.gle/Di4UxWk8TrUivy8y9

254.description: Power to Change UBC is a part of the nationwide Christian organization, Power to Change, which is composed of ministries with a common purpose of making Jesus known across Canada and worldwide. Our mission is to help post-secondary students take their next step toward Jesus, where life transformation happens among students, like you, for we believe life together with Jesus is what brings hope, meaning and depth. Check out our Instagram for more information on our weekly gatherings, discipleship groups, retreats, and events!

256.description: The UBC Pre-Veterinary and Animal Welfare Club is open to any who adores animals and desires to better the lives of animals. We hold information sessions on volunteer opportunities or internships for students interested in becoming veterinarians or working in animal welfare. We also hold fun events for students, that foster a strong community of like-minded people, such as trivia nights or animal therapy. Additionally, we do fundraisers for animal related organizations throughout the year. Most importantly, we hold many information sessions on potential veterinary schools from all over the world!

257.description: Here at PSA, our mission is to enhance the personal, professional, and academic success of UBC psychology students by working with the Department of Psychology. Along with the department, the PSA provides a variety of events and services over the academic year to foster community and enhance the future of our UBC Psychology and Behavioural Neuroscience students. Our club is the perfect place to be if you want to learn more about the field of psychology and its various avenues or even if you want to meet more people who think about the same things as you. Some highlighted events include CV Workshops, the Hanging Out with a Prof series, the Psychology Undergraduate Research Conference (PURC), and the Year End Gala – to name a few.

258.description: Our mission is to promote Indian Classical and Fusion music within the Greater Vancouver area and let students showcase their talent and experience. We want to present the genre of Indian Classical music to individuals of various backgrounds and expand on it by fusing together various musical styles. We create fusion pieces that we perform several times a year. If you have a passion for singing, or if you play an instrument - come join a vibrant community to nurture and share your talent! We welcome people of all talents and skill levels. Our members particularly enjoy coming together to create exciting compositions. If you have an idea for a performance, we'd love to hear it!

261.description: Roots on the Roof is a student-led club that manages the rooftop garden on the AMS Student Nest. We raise awareness of where food comes from and encourage community participation in growing it! We believe in the importance of food sovereignty, community building, equity, and skill sharing. We always welcome volunteers and new club members. To volunteer with us, just come to any of our drop-in sessions ! Follow us on Instagram, or join our newsletter to be notified of any workshops or events we host.

263.club_name: Russian Speaking Student Community of the AMS

264.description: STEM Fellowship is a student-run, national organization that provides a platform for students interested in STEM fields to connect with one another and with professionals, engage in research and improve skills in scholarly writing. We seek to enable students to learn collaboratively, express their passion and love for science, and expand the scope of human knowledge through scientific, multidisciplinary inquiry. Check out our instagram or send us an email! ubc@stemfellowship.org Instagram

265.description: Sargam UBC is UBC's only Indian music band! We explore the art of Indian classical music by bringing elements of Carnatic and Hindustani music styles into various other styles of music ranging from Bollywood to popular english songs. What results is transformative, innovative fusion pieces that we perform at musical events and showcase at our big annual concert: Raagini. Raagini is Sargam's annual concert and our biggest event of the year! Every spring, We showcase a range of musical styles, languages, genres, and talents by crafting innovative arrangements of songs and highlighting elements of Indian classical music. Here is one of our favourite pieces from Raagini 2023! All of our past Raagini performance videos are available on the official Sargam youtube channel.

266.description: Science One Survivors (SOS) is a club run by Science One alumni to support Science One students. Our main goals are to make sure Science One students have a smooth transition from high school to university and to help maintain a strong network of Science One alumni.

267.description: The UBC Seri Malaysia Club (SMC) was founded in 1993 at the University of British Columbia, Canada, in hopes of catering to the needs of Malaysian students at UBC. It is a social and cultural club, which serves not only as a support group for Malaysian students who are far away from home, but also as a place where Malaysian students can get together with other Malaysians. It is also our goal to promote and share the Malaysian culture with students of UBC through our sociocultural events. Stay connected by following us on social media and joining our online communication channels to stay updated on upcoming events and opportunities. Feel free to reach out via email or our contact form for any inquiries, suggestions, or to learn more about becoming a member. We look forward to welcoming you to the Seri Malaysia Club family!

268.description: The UBC Singapore Students’ Association is a sociocultural club at the University of British Columbia (Vancouver) that is comprised of Singaporeans and UBC students interested in Singaporean culture. As a club, we strive to build a strong, lasting and welcoming community. Throughout the school year, we seek to foster friendships among our members, provide a support base for Singaporean students, and offer our members various unique opportunities and experiences. Our members are from all over the world and from all walks of life, and we welcome anyone and everyone to be a part of our community!

269.description: SPHR is a non-profit student-based organization advocating on a social justice platform to uphold the rights of the Palestinian people.

270.description: SALSA is UBC’s official undergraduate society affiliated with the Department of Linguistics. We represent students from various fields of study including Linguistics, First Nations Languages and Linguistics, and Speech Sciences as well as specializations in Cognitive Systems, Psychology, French, Spanish, Anthropology, and more – all are welcome to join! As a member of SALSA, you get lots of great benefits during your time studying Linguistics at UBC! We offer academic and career planning support in programs and events like Peer Tutoring or Career Panel talks, as well as providing information on many new research or volunteer opportunities as they come up. We also hold social events for students wanting to unwind and connect with their classmates and more!

274.description: The Thaqalayn Muslim Association is a non-affiliated Muslim student association at UBC dedicated to creating a welcoming and intellectual space for all to learn about the teachings of Islam and make new connections. The heart of al-Thaqalayn of UBC lies in the saying of the prophet, " I leave among you the two weighty things: the Book of Allah and my Progeny! Allah’s book is (like) a rope extending from heaven to earth, and my progeny are the (Ahlul-Bayt). The Merciful informed me that the two will never part... I warn you against deserting them."

275.club_name: The AMS Anatomy and Dissection Club at UBC
275.description: Our mission is to foster curiosity, hands-on learning, and community through immersive experiences in anatomy and dissection. We provide opportunities for students to explore mammalian anatomy, engage in dissection workshops, and observe histology up close. By connecting with professors, researchers, and peers, we help students navigate pathways to research and medical careers. Whether through Q&A panels, exam prep sessions, or fun activities like trivia and arts and crafts nights, our goal is to create a supportive and fun community for learning and collaboration across all levels of study.

276.description: The UBC Pre-Optometry Club is dedicated to guiding students passionate about pursuing a career in optometry while fostering a strong community of students with shared goals. Throughout the school year, we host both in-person and virtual information sessions featuring admissions representatives from top optometry schools across North America. These sessions provide key guidance into the application process, admission requirements and the unique offerings of each optometry school. Our club also offers opportunities to connect with clinics for volunteer and internship positions, allowing members to gain hands-on experience in the optometry field. Students can enhance their clinical skills through pre-testing patients and learning about the day-to-day responsibilities of an optometrist. For those preparing for the Optometry Admission Test (OAT), we offer exclusive discounts on top resources like OATBooster. We also host engaging events such as seminars on OptomCAS, OAT prep, interviews, and the application process. Members can also attend social events where they can network with optometrists and get answers to all their career-related questions. Whether you’re just starting out or gearing up for applications, our club ensures you’re equipped with the knowledge and support needed to succeed. Join our community today and take the first step towards your future in optometry!

277.description: The Aviary is a climbing wall located in the AMS Nest on the UBC Vancouver campus. We are open to everybody and have top rope, lead climbing, and an array of training tools to suit both new and experienced climbers. You do not need to be a UBC student to climb here :) Check out our website for more info.

278.club_name: The Manufacturing Engineering Undergraduate Club of the University of British Columbia
278.description: We are UBC MANU. Our goal is to advance the academic and social interests of undergraduate students of the Manufacturing Engineering program at UBC Vancouver.

279.description: The UBC Navigators welcomes all students to explore faith in Jesus. Everyone is invited to join our weekly Bible studies, small groups and community events! We provide a safe, fun, and trustworthy environment where we learn about Jesus and everyday discipleship. Our mission is "To Know Christ, make Him know and help others do the same."

280.description: Who are we? We are students and community members who believe that dancing should be accessible to everyone and who want to create a space for people to come together and share their love of cuban dancing. We are beginner friendly, so no dancing experience is required! Our senior members teach dance classes every Wednesday from 7-8pm, followed by social dancing from 8-9pm. What do we do as a club? Rueda de casino is a form of dancing originating in Cuba in which couples dance together and trade partners around a circle as a caller calls out moves. Complimentary lessons? What's the catch? There is no catch. We want to provide a space for people interested in dance to share their experience and to help foster a more cohesive community at UBC. Our club fees are only $5 for the year for students and $8 for non-students.

281.description: We are a group of students at the University of British Columbia in Vancouver who share a passion for astronomy. We welcome students of any discipline who would like to meet other people with like-minded interests. Our club's goal is to educate and promote interest in astronomy through the various types of events we run, including: dark-sky observations, social activities, a lecture series, and outreach initiatives. We're always looking for more opportunities. The UBC Astronomy Club is committed to being an open and inclusive club for everyone regardless of race, ethnicity, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, and other diverse backgrounds.

283.club_name: The UBC Engineering Physics Student Association

285.description: The Thunderbird Dance Team is a Hip Hop and Street Jazz dance team at UBC! Created in 1997 by Moe Brody, we have been performing at various events, showcases, sports games, etc. for years.

286.description: The Thunderbird Marching Band encompasses the spirit of music and student life. Founded in 2012, the band is is talented, passionate and growing. Performing regularly at events on campus and in the greater Vancouver community, the Thunderbird Marching Band goes to great lengths to spread school spirit and uplifting music.

287.description: 英属哥伦比亚大学中国大学生联合会（University of British Columbia Chinese University students Association），UBC中国学子的资源共享平台。我们立志成为UBC最有态度的非营利性资源共享平台。我们将致力于通过别具匠心的方式，同时为新入学的学生，已经在UBC就读的学生，以及学生家长等对接所需资源。在搭建UBC及全球海内外华人之间的桥梁时，打破UBC校内外，及温哥华华人与外部各界的沟通壁垒。 The University of British Columbia Chinese University students Association is a resource sharing platform for Chinese students at UBC. We aspire to become the most positive non-profit resource sharing platform at UBC. We will strive to connect new students, students already studying at UBC, and parents with the resources they need in a unique way. While building a bridge between UBC and Chinese people around the world, we will break down the communication barriers between UBC and the outside world, and between Chinese people in Vancouver and the outside world. 大家可以通过下方链接填写招新报名表成为我们的一员，或者点击左边的公众号，小红书及ins关注我们的后续活动！谢谢您的支持！ You can fill in the application form to become one of us through the link below, or click on the official account and Instagram on the left to follow our subsequent activities! Thank you for your support! https://jsj.top/f/EN9z39

288.description: ABOUT US UBC A Cappella is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded land of the Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), Stó:lō and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh), and xwməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam) Nations. Our story started in 2007: the UBC A Cappella Club was formed, comprising of one group called "The Undeclared Majors." 18 years later, our club has grown to include four auditioned ensembles, one non-auditioned ensemble, and two competitive ICCA groups. We are proud to be the largest Collegiate A Cappella collective in Canada. A close-knit family of singers, songwriters, and vocal percussionists, our rehearsals are full of singing, collaborating, laughing, and bonding with students from all faculties. Our repertoire is representative of the diverse musical influences brought to the group by our members, and we look forward to sharing it with you!

290.description: Welcome to your BSU! The UBC Black Student Union (BSU) is a vibrant and inclusive community dedicated to supporting, empowering, and celebrating Black students at the University of British Columbia. Our mission is to foster a space where Black students can thrive academically, socially, and culturally while building meaningful connections. We host a variety of events from empowering discussions and advocacy initiatives to fun, laid-back gatherings like our popular kickbacks! Whether you’re looking to connect with others or simply enjoy some good vibes, the BSU is here for you!

291.description: The UBC English Students’ Association strives to provide English Majors, Minors, and Honours students with the opportunity to engage with each other and form a meaningful sense of community within and beyond the UBC English department. We hold a mix of academic and social events throughout the year such as Meet the Profs, Halloween Party, Pub Nights, Board Games Nights, Colloquium, and Papers Workshops, bookended with our two Annual General Meetings. These events provide students with the opportunity to connect with peers, colleagues, and faculty. Our signature academic event is The Colloquium, which is now in its sixth year; The Colloquium is an academic conference run solely by the ESA where undergraduate students, graduate students, and faculty present their work to colleagues and peers. The Colloquium encourages the development of relevant presentation skills and provides the opportunity for students to network. The Colloquium is supported by a team of student editors and an executive editorial team from the ESA, and we aim to curate an open and welcoming developmental opportunity for both students and faculty.

292.description: The UBC Neuroscience Association (UNA) aims to provide social and academic events to student members in order to foster a community within the undergraduate neuroscience community. Some of our biggest events have included the Neuroscience Undergradute Research Conference (NURC), Neuroscience Gala, Drinks with a Prof, Murder Mystery Night and Journal Clubs . While many members are undergraduate students in the neuroscience program, UNA welcomes any student at UBC!

293.description: UBC PhotoSoc strives to foster the art of photography within the campus community. Through our events, workshops, and services, we provide a place for photographers and photography enthusiasts to grow, connect, and inspire.

294.description: We are a student-run AMS Club at the University of British Columbia, officially sanctioned by Triathlon BC. We train together throughout the year and travel to various races and multisport events. Whether you’re passionate about swimming, biking, running, or any combination of these, we welcome athletes of all levels, from beginners to experienced. Join our inclusive and supportive community where everyone is welcome! Each new member gets a one week free trial , after which membership fees are due (even during the free trial you must sign up AND receive a confirmation email before you attend the swims).

296.description: The UBC Accounting Club is one of the largest clubs in the Sauder School of Business. Our three values are connect, community, and collaborate. We aim to build connections between UBC students and industry professionals at accounting firms across BC through events, information sessions, and social media engagement. To stay the most up-to-date with the UBC Accounting Club, feel free to check our Instagram @ubcaccounting!

298.description: UBC Agapé is an AMS club committed to serving the houseless and marginalized communities in Vancouver. It was founded in 2007 but, it was officially recognized by the AMS in 2010. We aim to create a safe space where members can make a tangible difference while also growing personally through service. Whether through volunteering, planning fun social events for our members, or expanding outreach efforts, we believe in showing love and kindness to our neighbours, all while building a strong, supportive community within our club. Our club was inspired by Agapé Street Ministry, a catholic group which provides street outreach in Downtown, and Mrs. Ellen Shonsta, popularly known as "Mom", was a part of it. Ellen Shonsta delivered food to the houseless people in Vancouver, despite being confined to a scooter due to arthritis. "When you make a connection with someone who has no one, it changes his life because he realizes he's worthy," says Ellen. "And this changes your life because you have changed his." In the past we have been funded by groups like Pepsi Refresh Everything Fund, Safeway, Vancouver Arbutus Rotary Club, Walter H Gage Memorial Funds, and others. We are incredibly grateful for their support and we look forward to more sponsorships so that we can reach more people and make a meaningful difference in the community.

299.description: Welcome to UBC Anime Club! We are a social club that brings together students who share a passion for anime, manga, and Japanese culture. Every Friday we host free , drop-in weekly events on campus, featuring artist meet-ups , anime screenings , and a different main activity each week! These include but are not limited to: Karaoke Nights Cosplay Workshops Board Game Nights Dance Workshops We also run larger, seasonal events, such as holiday-themed socials and our one-day annual convention Pop-Up Hanami , as well as outings and collaborations with other clubs. While we are an 'anime' club, we house a broad community who also have interests in adjacent areas like: rhythm and video games; fashion and cosplay; seiyuu and vocaloid; light novels, manhwa, manhua, and webtoons; art, music, and photography; generally anything you'd geek out about! So come hang and chill with us—you don't even have to watch anime ;)

300.description: Hey Ocean lovers and marine sports enthusiasts Here at UBC Aqua Society, we take our passion towards the ocean to the next step, getting our feet wet and diving into the depth of our local oceans. We are a club for divers and non-divers to get together and share our interests towards the ocean, offering ocean related events from diving to trivia nights.

301.description: A place to just relax and learn/practice archery! We aim to be a range where you can shoot and socialize in an community. We hold competitive target shoot as well as just personal practice. All UBC students, staff, alumni and even local Vancouver community are welcome! We occasionally hold events such as 3D shoots, tournaments and fun activities like Halloween Shoots! Even if you have no experience in shooting, this is the perfect place to learn with our certified coaches. Do not worry about equipment as we provide bows and arrows but if you wish to bring your own gear, you are more than welcome! Feel free to contact us if you have any questions!

302.club_name: UBC BC Water & Waste Association Student Chapter

303.description: The UBC-BCIT Biotechnology Club was founded to support the endeavors of the students in the joint UBC-BCIT Honours in Biotechnology Program. As students take all of their courses at BCIT for their second and third years in a cohort-manner, it is important to foster relations between those in each cohort, as well as between cohorts. Thus, this club serves to hold events and foster relations within and between cohorts. Furthermore, to introduce biotechnology students to the prospective jobs that they may choose to venture into in the future, the Biotechnology club hopes to connect said students, as well as others interested in the field of biotechnology, with company representatives at our annual Biotechnology Networking Night event. Students that are in the Honours in Biotechnology program are automatically enrolled as members in the Biotechnology Club. Members are informed first about upcoming events, participate in socials (ex. Annual Biotechnology BBQ), and are allowed to vote for executive members.

304.description: We're an AMS-registered club aiming to build a welcoming environment for students of all skill levels to play badminton together, make new friends and adjust to the university lifestyle! We offer weekly drop-in nights that are open to our club members and strive to focus on community-building. We also host monthly events for our members, including fun social nights and badminton tournaments of various formats.

305.description: UBC Ballet Club is committed to creating, performing, and teaching contemporary ballet at UBC. We believe in making ballet accessible to everyone by offering weekly ballet classes for a range of levels, monthly workshops, and a performance company. We hope to help grow the dance community at UBC, and provide a welcoming environment where ballet can be shared.

308.description: The UBC Biological Sciences Society (BIOSOC) is a student-run organization that has been continuously growing for decades. What started as a small group of students looking to hold social events has become one of the largest science societies on campus. We strive to cater to the needs and desires of Biology students, offering numerous involvement opportunities in research, academics, and recreation. Our goal is to build a vibrant, supportive community here in UBC Biology. Come find us in BioSci. Room 1127 during office hours (posted outside the room and on our instagram) or contact us on Facebook, Instagram, or Linked In.

309.description: UBC BizChina is a club founded in 2011 that focuses on hosting large-scale conferences, networking events and corporate presentations to benefit all students. We aim to bridge the gap between China and Canada where students ambitions in a career related to China and Sino-Canadian business can be developed.

310.description: At BizTech, we bridge the gap between business, technology and you . As UBC's largest technology club with over 600 members and 40 executives, we create immersive experiences in various fields regardless of your chosen area of study. Whether you are attending a conference, hackathon, or mentorship program, we strive to foster an active community of students and professionals through learning opportunities, enduring relationships, and interactive industry engagements. Named the 2021/22 and 2023/24 AMS Best Academic Club of the Year, come meet new people, build your network, and learn about the influence of technology in business!

313.description: Welcome to UBC Botany Enthusiasts Club! We are a diverse collection of plant lovers, dedicated to the exploration, education and celebration of our local flora and the world of plants. We aim to teach students gardening and botany skills through workshops and tutorials, to encourage students to be more sustainable, to collaborate with gardening and sustainability groups on campus, and to give UBC students— of all faculties, backgrounds and experiences— a space to share their appreciation for the botanical world.

314.description: The UBC Boxing Club is one of the biggest sports clubs at UBC! We provide a fun, engaging, challenging, and educational environment by teaching the skills and techniques involved in boxing! Classes typically involve a light warmup, followed by pad work/technique drills, and ending with a fun burnout exercise. The Boxing Club is a great way to stay active, meet new people, and have fun! It’s both mentally and physically engaging, which is often the perfect way to get your mind away from all the stress of schoolwork/exams! Everyone is welcome to join, whether you’re a complete beginner, intermediate, or advanced!

315.description: Interested in homebrewing? Welcome to the UBC Brewing Club! The UBC Brewing Club is a great place to learn how to brew beer, mead, cider, and other fermented beverages, as well as meet like-minded people. We are always interested in teaching new members the brewing process, so no experience is required!

316.description: What is UBC C4? UBC C4 is a non-audition choir for singers of all experience levels . Most of our pieces are composed by our club members and other members of the UBC community. We host beginner-friendly workshops every term on a variety of topics ranging from music composition to vocal technique and more. If you are a singer, composer, or instrumentalist looking for a casual space to grow and meet fellow enthusiasts, we are the club for you! Club Activities (2025 Term 1) View the calendar here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1z-md6HjiiIHqpyszvlRndAOrnjcfFXWI8kfagULukTA We will have the following schedule: Main Rehearsals: Weekly on Mondays (Sept 22-Dec 1, 2025), 6:15PM-7:45PM in IRC B79 (Woodward Instructional Resources Center basement floor) This is the core club activity for singers. We will learn new pieces and rehearse our main club repertoire at this time. In-person, drop-in Composer Meets: Monthly workshops biweekly on Thursdays (Date and Time will be scheduled on Discord!) This is the core club activity for composers, arrangers, songwriters, and producers. Activities are shaped by members and change depending on experience levels/interests/etc. How to join? To get all details of the club, please join our discord server: https://linktr.ee/ubcc4 All club activities (except the end-of-term concert) are open to everyone and do not require a membership! You can drop-in at any point in the term: w e spend 2 rehearsals per piece before moving on to the next one, so you are welcome to join anytime. Club members ($2 for AMS, $3 for non-AMS students) will be allowed to perform at our end-of-term concert to celebrate all that we have learned! :)

317.description: It's a party — and you're invited! EST. 1930 Join UBC's largest social club , which offers tons of events, such as parties , bunny yoga , karaoke , talent shows , trips to Mexico , and more! With 11 departments, there will always be something for you. CVC embodies the idea of work hard, party harder , so if you crave fun socials outside of school or want to make lots of new friends, join us for this crazy year Memberships: MEMBERSHIP COST: $15 MEMBERSHIP + FSU PASS: $18 Membership Benefits: Discounted price for ALL CVC events Member-only giveaways (Contact tickets, Steve's Poke, Chipotle, Espot, etc) Discounts and perks with our sponsors (Bounce, Good Day Soju, Rumble Boxing, Blueprint, Wizeprep, Rice Burger, Steve's Poke, Liquid Iv, and more) Wanna Stay Updated? http://www.ubccvc.ca/ Instagram: @ubc.cvc Tiktok: @ubccvc

319.description: W elcome to the UBC Canadian Wheelchair Club! Our mission is to promote inclusivity, support, and empowerment for individuals with disabilities. As a community-driven organization, we aim to provide a space where members can connect, share experiences, and engage in activities that foster physical and social well-being. Our motto "Helping the 100 Million" refers to our ongoing efforts to support and better the lives of individuals facing significant challenges in access to mobility devices. It signifies our ambitious goal and collective commitment to positively impact the lives of over 100 million people worldwide who are neglected and marginalized due to disabilities. We believe that through our collective efforts, we can strive to create meaningful change and ensure these individuals can obtain the support and resources they need to thrive.

320.description: Are you a Chess Fan? New to the game? A Grand Master? We are the place! For everyone on campus, or off, interested in chess, com check us out!

321.club_name: UBC Chinese Hanmai Club at UBC

323.club_name: UBC Chinese Students and Scholars Association

325.description: The UBC Conservatives is the official student club of the Conservative Party of Canada at the University of British Columbia (UBC), Vancouver. Our club is made up of a diverse group of students who share a passion for conservative principles and values. We are committed to promoting and advancing conservative ideas on campus, and in the broader community. As a club, we strive to provide a platform for students to engage in meaningful discussions about conservative policies, as well as opportunities to get involved in local and national politics. We regularly host guest speakers, organize events and debates, and participate in community outreach initiatives. Our mission is to foster a welcoming and inclusive environment for all members, regardless of their background or political views. We believe in the power of respectful discourse and open-mindedness, and we encourage our members to engage in thoughtful and constructive dialogue with others who may hold different opinions. Overall, the UBC Conservatives are dedicated to promoting conservative principles and values, and to providing a space for students to get involved in politics and make a difference in their community.

326.description: UBC Cooking Club aims to foster a community of cooking enthusiasts through the promotion of food preparation skills and the enjoyment of delicious food. Members will be able to develop their cooking skill in a fun and safe environment under the guidance of our friendly cooking coordinators. We welcome all food lovers and strive to create a closely-knit family with the help of our dedicated members. Our events, workshops, and socials will assist members with their lifestyle as university students.

329.description: Established in 2009, the UBC Dance Team is a dance company composed of UBC students with several years of competitive experience. The company's members come from a variety of dance backgrounds, and our choreography incorporates many varying genres including contemporary, jazz, lyrical, and tap. Although we are mostly self-choreographed, we are fortunate to be able to work alongside guest choreographers every year. We perform at various fundraisers and events at UBC and in the Greater Vancouver area such as the Wesbrook Village Festival, Storm the Wall, Relay for Life, Get Schooled, and UBC Kinesiology Week. As a team, we strive to build collaborative relationships with other UBC clubs and organizations, such as World Vision and UBC REC. A passion for dance is difficult to let go of and the UBC Dance Team allows committed dancers an opportunity to pursue their academic studies while enjoying high-caliber dance training on the beautiful UBC Campus.

333.description: The UBC Dragon Boating Club is a competitive sports club that represents the University of British Columbia and the Alma Mater Society in recreational and competitive dragon boating. Dragon boating is similar to canoeing and long boating but composed of 20 paddlers, 1 steer and 1 caller all in a single boat. Typical race distances include 200 meters, 500 meters and 2 kilometer races. Training begins in October and the main race season occurs in May and June, with some smaller races also happening in July and August. All races and practices are held in False Creek, near Science World. The recreation team practices on Monday between 6:45-8:45 pm and Saturdays from 11:00 am - 1:00pm. The competitive team also practices on Monday and Saturday at the same time, but also has an additional practice on Thursday 6:45-8:45 pm. Our club is welcome and open to all people who are willing to dedicate their time to attending practices weekly and willing to try their best to continue to improve at every practice.

335.description: Bringing raw energy and fresh music to @universityofbc @ams_ubc affiliated student club

336.description: The UBC Environmental Policy Association (EPA) aims to promote awareness, education, and advocacy for environmental policy and contemporary social and environmental issues. The club engages in discussion of current policies, major policy events such as the COP, and incorporating sustainability into various professions and industries. Our goal is to inspire students to be more aware of environmental policies and global issues, and to make learning about these topics more accessible for the UBC community. We welcome anyone with a passion for the environment and policies that concern it.

337.description: Welcome all horse lovers and enthusiasts! At UBC Equestrian Club, you'll have a chance to ride horses at a leisure pace. Whether you're a returning rider or an absolute beginner, there is a place for everyone. No high commitment needed :) Follow us on our social media platforms for club updates and/or join our mailing list for email updates!

338.description: The UBC Esports Association is a non-profit, student run organization based out of the University of British Columbia. Our vision is to foster an inclusive esports community in the Greater Vancouver area. We offer events such as competitive tournaments, social events, celebrity meetups, and more!

339.description: We are the UBC Fencing Club! We provide a welcoming environment to practice the sport of Olympic Fencing. We welcome all skill levels! From complete beginner... all the way to total experts! We practice all 3 weapon types: foil, epee, and sabre. Our schedule and other info (fees, FAQ, etc.) are posted on our website and social medias. If you have questions, contact us on Instagram (@ubcfencing) or through email (fencingubc@gmail.com).

340.description: The UBC Film Society runs weekly screenings on campus, social events, and filmmaking workshops. We also host a weekly film-focused radio show on CiTR, and produce multiple student short films each year. Follow our instagram @ubcfilmsociety for all the updates!

342.description: Welcome! The UBC Food Science Club is an academic club looking for students from all disciplines to participate and contribute to an exciting year of food processing tours, demonstrations and experiments of our own. Look forward to learning the science behind wine and cheese pairings, making wine, brewing beer, making yogurt and cheese and all the great chemical reactions that happen in baked goods! For food science enthusiasts, this is a great low-key environment to share advice about courses, programs, and student life. Networking is an integral part of succeeding in your future career—start now in a low-pressure environment with your peers. Benefits of Joining FSC ·  Receive exclusive discounts on FSC events! ·   Being part of a community with fellow food science enthusiasts ·   Participate in hands-on food experiments, uncovering the science behind them ·   Connect and network with food industry professionals!

343.club_name: UBC Foundation of International Medical Relief for Children

344.description: At the UBC Game Show Club, our mission is to infuse campus life with fun and spontaneity by hosting creative and entertaining events. We offer students a chance to unwind and connect through unique games that combine elements of popular game shows with unexpected twists. From Chess Tennis—where players switch between strategic moves and athletic volleys—to a fiery mashup of Hot Ones and Family Feud, we guarantee thrilling experiences. Our events are designed to bring unpredictability with concepts like Rule Roulette, where the rules change randomly,a speed-dating game show, and Name That Tune, but all the music is played backwards, all fostering community, laughter, and friendly competition. We also focus on enhancing teamwork, communication, and problem-solving skills in a lighthearted, engaging environment. The UBC Game Show Club aims to redefine the campus experience by providing a platform for students to escape academic pressures, connect, and make lasting memories.

345.description: Welcome! Please visit our website here for more information.

347.description: The UBC Go Club hosts weekly events that cater to Go enthusiasts of all skill levels. For beginners, we offer Go lessons covering everything from basic rules to advanced strategies, helping members quickly get started and improve their skills. For more experienced players, we organize weekly games and internal ranking tournaments, providing a friendly environment for members to compete and enhance their gameplay. Our club is dedicated to promoting and spreading Go culture, with a strong foundation in Chinese Go while also showcasing the rich Go traditions of East Asia. Whether you're new to the game or a seasoned player, the UBC Go Club offers a perfect platform for learning, exchanging ideas, and growing together. If you’re interested in joining us, please follow us on Instagram and send us a direct message to get in touch! We look forward to having you join us and explore the fascinating world of Go!

348.description: The UBC Heart & Stroke Foundation is a unique club at UBC, that has historically focused on education and fundraising efforts to support the Heart & Stroke Foundation at large. We aim to continue increasing our presence on campus and dedicate our efforts to running engaging events for the UBC student body to educate and fundraise for the Heart & Stroke Foundation. Within our eight committees: 1) Internal 2) Sports & Recreation 3) Initiatives 4) Outreach 5) Marketing 6) Sponsorship 7) Administration, and 8) Education, we have Coordinator positions open for any UBC undergraduate student to apply for! We also have General Membership available for anyone to join and gain perks such as discounts on services like BeMo Academic Consulting, internal and external mentorship, volunteer experience, campus engagement, and more!

349.description: Friends, Romans, History Nerds – lend me your ears! Welcome to UBC's official History club. Whether you want to write for our annual journal, connect with Faculty members, or simply attend a fun historical trivia night with some free pizza, then this is the club for you...

351.description: UBC's Improv Club offers a welcoming environment for all those who are interested in improvisational theatre (unscripted, spontaneous storytelling)! We host energetic shows, engaging workshops, and provide a safe space for people of all levels of improv experience to develop their skills, be creative, and play! Check out our videos to learn all the ways you can do and watch improv! Learn what improv is here! (video) Learn how to get involved with UBC Improv! (video) Learn more about memberships here

352.club_name: UBC Institute of Transportation Engineers (ITE) Student Chapter

354.description:
UBC Japan Association is a club centered around building a community around sharing and appreciating Japanese culture. 

We host events inspired by the cultural, social and sporting aspect of Japanese culture. We hold these events twice a month, and they are great opportunities to socialize, have fun, and learn about Japan. 

If you appreciate Japanese culture and are interested in having a good time, then we welcome you to join UBCJA! Knowing Japanese, or being Japanese is NOT required to join our community! See you at our next event ^_^

355.description: The UBC Japan Career Network (JCN) is a student-run club with a mission to support all those who envision a future career in Japan or in the Nikkei Industry. Founded in 2013, we have supported international students, exchange students, and domestic students for over a decade.

356.description: The UBC Jazz Club aims to create and foster and space for UBC students to meet new people and explore their passion for music through performance, collaboration, and appreciation. We host weekly jam sessions, perform in the Nest, and run a Big Band. In addition to that, we also have monthly catered social events such as collabs with other clubs, workshops, and our semester end galas! Check out our Instagram for more details and to stay up to date on upcoming events!

357.description: Welcome to the vibrant world of UBC Junoon at the University of British Columbia, Vancouver's throbbing dance centre. We are a lively group of international students who communicate across boundaries by using dance as a universal language. Focusing on a variety of intriguing genres, including hip-hop, contemporary, and Bollywood, our enthusiasm takes us to international competitions, where we compete with unmatched zeal. We take pride in being the only Bollywood-Fusion Competitive team in Canada.

359.description: UBC Kababayan is a student organization that strives to preserve and promote Filipino culture through a variety of school events and community engagement initiatives. Our purpose is to be a home away from home for fellow Filipinos, all while opening our doors to all nationalities to explore and learn about the Philippines' rich culture and tradition. KABA welcomes everyone and does not discriminate its membership and events on the basis of age, race, colour, disability, religion, sex, gender, etc.

360.description: UBC Kendo Club is part of the AMS Association and a recreational martial art club. Kendo, "The Way of the Sword" is the Japanese martial art of sword fighting.

361.description: The UBC Kung Fu Association is the first and longest running martial arts social club at UBC. We offer three different styles of martial arts: Sanda, Wushu and Lion Dance. Here, we focus on learning the application and cultures of martial arts, maintaining a healthy body and mind, and providing a place for students to gather and create connections. Whether you’re a complete beginner or an experienced martial artist, we welcome all experience levels to join our classes. Take advantage of our free trials to experience the UBC Kung Fu excitement firsthand and get your first class free! Check our weekly class schedule on Instagram, drop by our classes, and let an exec member know if you are interested in becoming a member. Come join our community and we can’t wait to see you in action!

364.description: Welcome to the UBC Loggersports Club!

365.description: The UBC Mexican Student Association's mission is to create a Mexican and non-Mexican community focused on promoting Mexican culture. Through various cultural, social, and academic events, we want to create a student network where people can share their opinions, ideas, and traditions. We want to create events where the UBC community is able to learn about Mexican culture and customs.

368.description: The UBC Mental Health Awareness Club (UBC MHAC) is a student-run initiative that was founded in the summer of 2010. We aim to destigmatize talks about mental health by providing students with free monthly events to help them destress. We are well-known for bringing Pet Therapy to UBC, where you can spend time with certified-therapy dogs around exam season. With every year, we aim to expand our club's outreach and further mental health advocacy. To stay updated, please follow our Instagram (@ubcmhac), where we regularly post "Wellness Wednesday" posts and announcements of our upcoming events! We look forward to meeting you all!

369.club_name: UBC Middle East Studies Students Association

370.description: The UBC mining undergraduate society (MUGS) is a student run organization for the students of the Norman B. Keevil Institute of Mining Engineering at UBC. We take pride in promoting and being apart of the global and dynamic mining industry. Our priorities are also to bring the best student life, academic help, and networking events we can to campus to help further connect our community. From our national competition teams: UBC Mine Rescue & Canadian Mining Games To our annual professional development events with real industry sponsors and alumni! Our executive team is excited and devoted to bring only the best for UBC Mining! Let us show you why we rock!

371.description: The UBC Multifaith Club is a student-led community dedicated to fostering understanding, respect, and collaboration among people of all faiths, spiritual traditions, and philosophical backgrounds. Our purpose is to create a welcoming and inclusive space where students can engage in meaningful dialogue, share their beliefs, learn from one another, and explore questions of purpose, identity, and community in a supportive environment. We believe that by encouraging open-minded conversations and genuine friendships across different worldviews, we contribute to a more compassionate and interconnected campus community. Through regular events such as discussion circles, guest speaker panels, interfaith service projects, and cultural celebrations, we aim to highlight the richness of diverse traditions while finding shared values that unite us all. The Multifaith Club is not tied to any specific religious organization. Instead, it celebrates the broad spectrum of spiritual and ethical perspectives represented at UBC. Whether you are deeply rooted in a tradition, exploring your spiritual path, or simply curious about how faith and philosophy shape the world around us, you are welcome here. Our club also partners with various groups on campus and in the broader Vancouver community to promote interfaith literacy, social justice, and community service.

372.description: UBC Music Initiative (UMI) is a student-run organization dedicated to providing opportunities for students to perform and share their music with the community. At UMI, we deeply believe in inspiring and uniting musicians and music-lovers to rediscover their love for musical performances. Our monthly socials allow members to showcase their talents and connect with UBC's music community, while our local concerts around Vancouver engage members in using their talents for good in the community at large. At its heart, UMI is committed to building passion and community among its members through the medium of music and performance.

377.description: Discover the Vibrant World of UBC Persian Club

378.description: Welcome to the UBC Pickleball Club! Whether you're new to the game or a seasoned player, our club is the perfect place to enjoy the fastest-growing sport in North America. We offer a fun, inclusive environment where students of all skill levels can play, learn, and compete. We provide our members with weekly games, tournaments, and social events designed to build friendships, sharpen skills, and promote a healthy, active lifestyle. Whether you're looking for casual play or competitive action, you'll find your place on the court with us. Come serve, rally, and smash your way into the UBC pickleball community!

379.description: Welcome to the University of British Columbia's premier destination for all things theatre -- UBC Players Club! As one of the oldest and the best clubs at UBC, the Players Club has a rich history of connecting students, faculty, and the wider community through the art of performance. Our mission is to provide safe, inclusive, and accessible opportunities for anyone at UBC to participate in all aspects of UBC theatre!

380.description: FOUNDED IN 1977, THE UBC POLITICAL SCIENCE STUDENTS' ASSOCIATION (PSSA) IS AN ENTIRELY STUDENT-RUN DEPARTMENTAL CLUB, SUPPORTED BY THE UBC POLITICAL SCIENCE DEPARTMENT. OUR MISSION At the PSSA, we foster a tight-knit community of students and faculty in an environment of mutual trust and respect. We strive to provide all undergraduate students interested in political science with opportunities to learn more about the discipline by hosting entertaining, informative, and social events that connect them with other students with similar interests as well as professionals. We engage in serious debate which sheds light on the most pressing political issues while advocating for the interests and concerns of over 800 Political Science students. Our ultimate goal is to cultivate a prosperous undergraduate environment for Political Science students. Our endeavours include the continuation of two conferences, Moot Court and Model Parliament as well as general events such as speaker panels, publishing opportunities with the Journal of Political Studies editorial team, and the third year of our Political Science Mentorship Program designed to make the university experience less daunting and more fulfilling! We send out bi-weekly emails detailing events, projects, department news, and global news. We proudly publish the Journal of Political Studies (JPS) in partnership with the UBC Department of Political Science. The JPS, one of the longest-running and most highly regarded undergraduate research journals in the country, is entirely student-run, from the editorial board to the graphic designers. The JPS is where we showcase the most exemplary and innovative research in the undergraduate political science community. Finally, we do our best to bring the UBC Political Science Department closer to what students really need, by presenting policy proposals at faculty meetings.

381.description: UBC Pre-Law is more than just a club. It's a space where students can explore their interest in law, meet new people, and take meaningful steps toward their future.

382.description: The UBC Pre-Medical Society is proud to host interactive events such as Mock MCAT day, Mock Mini Interviews, Suture Clinics, Dinner with Doctors & more in collaboration with our pre-medical industry partners each year. Check out our socials to learn more about how you can get involved and meet other aspiring pre-medical students!

383.description: The UBC Psychedelic Society is a group of passionate individuals who recognize the ability of psychedelic substances to facilitate altered states of consciousness that are invaluable for therapy and personal growth, as well as for enriching many fields of scientific and intellectual inquiry. We would like to promote an unbiased, fact-based discussion of these substances centered around their application to areas such as psychiatry, clinical psychology, neuroscience, philosophy, and sociology, and aim to help further the evident 21st-century Psychedelic Renaissance.

385.club_name: UBC Quizbowl Club of the AMS
385.description: Welcome! UBC Quizbowl is a place for all to enjoy trivia. We host "practices" twice a week where we meet up and play questions on topics such as science, history, literature, fine arts, and pop culture. If you're interested in competing, we send teams to quizbowl tournaments both online (over Zoom) and in-person to face off against other universities. Last year, we sent a team of four players to Chicago to compete in the Intercollegiate Championship Tournament, where we placed 14th out of 32 teams. We also partake in more casual trivia activities together, such as pub trivia. If you're an experienced Reach for the Top player, Jeopardy fan, or new to trivia, come check us out!

386.description: UBC RISE is a platform built on Relating, Inspiring, Sharing, and Empathizing.

388.description: UBC Red Cross is a student-run non-profit club that upholds the seven values of the Canadian Red Cross: humanity, voluntary service, impartiality, neutrality, independence, unity, and universality. Through our five committees, we run volunteer events, host training sessions, organize speaker series, raise money, and so much more. We’re committed to improving the UBC and Vancouver community, as well as supporting global causes.

389.description: We are SISU UBC! A wellness & recreation club at the University of British Columbia in Vancouver, BC Our mission is to empower young women by fostering the values of purpose 𖣠﹒grit ✧﹒resilience ★ through adventures, fitness, and wellness based community initiatives ♡

391.club_name: UBC Scandinavian and Nordic Student Association
391.description: Velkommen! (That's Welcome in Norwegian) We are a UBC club for students who are interested in the Nordic countries and want to meet other students who share this interest. Some members are from the Nordic region and want to strengthen their connection here in Canada, though most are simply interested in the Nordic region and want to learn more about it and participate in activities from different cultures alongside a community of students! Visit our Website or Instagram for more information about the club and our events! We host many events throughout the year, both social and academic. Movie nights, game nights, trivia nights, guest speakers, and monthly pub nights are just a selection of our recurring events! Every year, we also host a massive end of year event and a stunning Christmas Lucia performance! Here are a couple of our most popular offerings:

392.description: UBC Science Digest fosters an engaging learning community for students by promoting critical thinking and analysis of scientific research. Through article discussions , otherwise known as 'journal clubs' in industry and academia, students will refine their analytical skills, stay updated on recent advancements, and cultivate a habit of continuous learning. The journal club also provides a collaborative platform for exchanging diverse perspectives, practicing communication skills, and encouraging professional growth through peer and occasional faculty interactions (events TBA!) . This environment supports clear, concise presentation of complex information, vital for academic and professional success.

393.description: The UBC SFS is a welcoming community for fans of sci-fi and/or fantasy! We consume & discuss movies, books, comics, games, & more. Join us for weekly board game/movie nights, Book Club, Writing Circle, and other shenanigans! Our Movie & Board Game Nights are on Friday evenings, starting again in September . Aside from our Halloween party, Christmas party, and End-of-Year party (Requires membership), they are open to everyone- come say hi! Our Writing Circle meetings (Members only starting after Clubs Days) will be held weekly, time decided in September. Our Book Club meetings (Members only starting after Clubs Days) will be held weekly, time decided in September. We also have an extensive library of Sci-Fi and Fantasy novels, movies, comics, and more in our club room, available for members to borrow- send us a message to come have a look or borrow a book! Catalog (In Progress): https://www.librarycat.org/lib/UBC_SFS

395.description: The Sikh Students’ Association of UBC was established in 1985 and is a way for students at UBC to connect with each other and with Sikhi while making impactful contributions to the greater Lower Mainland community. As a club, we hope to make learning about and experiencing Sikhi more accessible to university students and foster a positive community for Sikh students. Our club hosts multiple large-scale events each year including langar days, kirtans, and social events for all interested university students. We also organize multiple group discussions, kaur & singh socials, and prayer sessions which allow us to talk about Gurbani and discuss it in Sangat (community). Below you can find details on some of our key event. Everyone is welcome to come and learn about the faith and participate in whatever capacity they'd like!

396.description: What is the UBC Ski & Board Club? We are a community for people stoked on skiing/snowboarding! We host trips to the mountains, parties, various events and overall are a club to meet new homies. You don't need any ski/snowboard experience to join and can be in any year, any program. Whatever your situation is we are happy to have you in the club! Trips Our first trip is Condo Cram in Whistler for opening weekend. Then we have 3 more in second semester to Revelstoke, Whitewater, and Baker. We subsidize all our trips so it is guaranteed the best deal you'll find. Spots are limited for trips and we usually drop tickets over multiple days. In-person sales with cash. What else? Besides trips we have plenty other opportunities to ride and meet homies, including a Girls Ride Day, Park Days, on campus Rail Jams, freeride events and booter sessions. We also have rad Jazzercise events including cliff jumping, going to the aquatic center, yoga, dryland, etc. Parties If you like to party this is the club for you. We've got house parties, keggers, party busses, downtown events and so much more. We are always down for a goot time and host 1-2 parties per month minimum. Memberships Memberships are $20 and provide you with tons of discounts, cheap entry to parties and you need a membership to come on any trips. You can purchase one at any time and it lasts the whole school year. Link on this site, or in our Insta bio, to purchase online with Bounce. Bounce is where we'll be selling most event tickets this year. You can also stop by the club office in room 3301H in the nest to pay with cash or just chat. Follow Us The best way to stay up to date is by following our Instagram and turning on post notifications! Our DMs are always open if you have any questions.

397.description: UBC Slam Poetry is an AMS club that strives to create a warm and creative space for folks to perform, enjoy, and practice poetry. What do we offer as a club: 1) We host open mic + feature events where we invite a rotation of professional local poets to share their work. Our open mic is open is available to everyone, even first time performers. 2) We host small group workshops where aspiring poets can discuss and hone their craft. Each workshop has a theme with unique guided activities. 3) We collect student submission for our chapbook where students have the chance to be published and get paid for their writing. 4) We keep you updated on our club and the local poetry community through our newsletter , with prompts and poems to keep you inspired. 5) We partner with poetry organizations throughout the city such as Death Rides a Unicorn so that students can attend cool events and get involved into the greater Vancouver poetry community. This also includes sending a representative to compete the Canadian Individual Poetry Slam during the Verses Festival of Words . 6) All of these events and projects are run by our amazing executive team . We are always looking for more help so come talk to us if you're interested in how we operate behind the scenes. If you want to get involved with our club, we post all of our events and opportunities to our Instagram!

399.description: The UBC Sociology Students’ Association (SSA) is an organization of student leaders dedicated to enriching the experiences of all Sociology and Arts students interested in the field of Sociology. As the only students’ association specifically dedicated to Sociology, our club’s core ideals are: Building, Connecting, and Empowering. ‘Building’ focuses on creating a foundation for student success in their university journeys. ‘‘Connecting’ envisions a campus environment which actively supports networks between faculty, undergraduate, and graduate students. Finally, ‘Empowering’ strives to empower students to use their sociology degree, giving them the tools to do so while creating an engaging space.

400.description: Welcome to UBC Sororities! We are a community of 500+ like-minded women from 8 different National Panhellenic Conference sorority chapters. Our members span across all faculties and programs at UBC, as well as a wide range of backgrounds and hometowns. The activities of our organizations reflect our shared values of academics, philanthropy and sisterhood, with a common goal of building strong and well-rounded individuals!

401.description: Sprouts is a 100% volunteer and student-run organization at the University of British Columbia (UBC). Through our many initiatives, we endeavor to make healthy, affordable, and sustainably produced food accessible to everyone on campus. We are based out of Sprouts Cafe in the basement of the Life Building. With rising food insecurity on campus, we have dedicated ourselves to making our high-quality food and produce available to all through our cafe, community fridge, produce market and free meal distribution.

403.club_name: UBC Students for Partners in Health Canada

404.club_name: UBC Supply Chain and Operations Association

407.description: Welcome to the Tamil Students' Association Page! The UBC Tamil Students' Association (UBC TSA) is a student-run organization and established with the aim of promoting and preserving the rich Tamil culture and heritage among Tamil students and the wider UBC community. UBC TSA provides a platform for Tamil students to come together, connect, and engage in various cultural, social, and educational activities.
