The association offers a diverse range of events and programs throughout the year, including cultural festivals, music and dance performances, language classes, and community service initiatives. These activities not only help to promote Tamil culture but also foster a sense of community and belonging among Tamil students at UBC. UBC TSA is committed to promoting diversity and inclusivity on campus and works to create a welcoming environment for all students, regardless of their background or cultural identity. The association also collaborates with other student organizations and community groups to raise awareness and support for various social issues affecting Tamil communities both locally and globally. Overall, UBC TSA serves as a valuable resource for Tamil students at UBC and plays an important role in promoting cultural diversity and awareness on campus. If you are interested in joining the club or hearing more about our future events, please fill out the form below AND click the JOIN button above ! Follow our IG page (@ubc.tsa) for more updates :)) https://forms.gle/BTXrr5uiYkpFmr787

408.description: The UBC Tax Assistance Clinic for Students (TACS) is a student-run non-profit club at UBC. Our team manages a free, government-certified tax clinic, while also hosting various events and literacy programs. Our goal is to promote tax literacy and provide our members with valuable networking experience to introduce accounting as a fulfilling and valuable career path.

409.club_name: UBC Telugu Students Association at UBC

411.club_name: UBC Third World Eye Care Society

413.description: Our Mission: Inspire students to take their education beyond the classroom and interact with the capital markets in the personal or professional context. Club Overview Established in 2011, UBC Trading Group is a diverse community of students linked by their mutual interest in impacting the future of capital markets. We are one of the largest student clubs with a community of 500+ members accumulated in the last five years. UBC Trading Group offers resources to members through events, workshops and content produced by our analyst team. After absorbing the UBC Quantitative Finance Club in 2019, we have established our own Quant Team that is focused on building an asset management model. Areas of Operation: Events, Workshops & Content Our events represent our effort to balance the needs of students aiming to gain relevant skills and network. In 2018, the group established an analyst team responsible for producing market concepts, equity research reports and market commentary. Market Concepts: Short educational pieces on the most important concepts for getting started with or improving your trading strategy. Equity Research Reports: Our reports analyze the company's business model, industry, financial growth and are great examples of how to use publicly available information to compute a valuation of a company. Weekly News & Market Commentary: Weekly market updates compiled and tailored for student reading. Plus in-depth bi-weekly commentary covering updates and insights in equities, fixed income, commodities, and foreign exchange. Be sure to follow and like us on our respective social media pages to stay up to date with our current and upcoming events!

416.description: UBC Water Polo is a dynamic and vibrant student-led organization. Open to both seasoned athletes and newcomers to the sport, we offer a supportive environment for developing water polo skills while emphasizing teamwork and fun. With regular practices, intra-club scrimmages, participation in local competitions, and occasional hangouts, our club provides an excellent opportunity for students to stay active and make lasting friendships.

417.description: We are the UBC Weightlifting and Powerlifting Club! We are the hub for lifting sports at UBC. We host weekly powerlifting and weightlifting training sessions with 1-on-1 coaching. Each session focuses on a specific lift and we alternate between beginner and advanced training sessions so there’s something for everyone. For our members looking for powerlifting meet experience, we host monthly mock competitions with prizes. Our club is best known for hosting the annual BCPA sanctioned UBC New Year’s Powerlifting Championships in the Nest every January. We welcome lifters of all experience levels! If you want to dip your toes into weight training or are a veteran lifter looking for a community, this is the club for you!.

418.description: The UBC Women in Science Club was founded to provide support for female undergraduates in Science fields. Our club has 3 pillars: Mentorship, Building Community, and Connecting People. Our club offers many events throughout the school year, including networking events with alumni, professional development workshops, and social events. We also offer an ongoing mentorship program. We envision that mentorship and networking relationships between professional women in various science fields and current undergraduate students will help those students through common challenges that arise for women pursuing careers in science. Our club's events are marketed towards a broad range of science students as we have speakers, presenters, and mentors from a variety of disciplines. This includes medicine, computer science, environmental science, science education, zoology, and life science. Our club hosts events that promote professional development and growth, skills that are not often taught in the UBC Science coursework.

419.description: Welcome to the U BC Field Lacrosse Club! Whether you're picking up a stick for the first time or have years of experience on the field, our club is the place to connect, compete, and share in the excitement of one of Canada's national sports.

421.description: Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children? Join UBC YNOTFORTOTS and help us provide kids in the Lower Mainland with the resources they need to play, learn, and grow! As a member, you’ll have the opportunity to lead donation drives, organize fun events, and work hands-on with the community to support children in need. This is your chance to get involved, make friends, and create a lasting impact. If you’re looking for a rewarding way to give back and make connections, UBC YNOTFORTOTS is the perfect club for you!

422.description: The UBC Yoga Club's mission is to provide affordable yoga to students and faculty at the University of British Columbia. On the busy campus of UBC, practicing yoga provides a way to calm the mind and body from the daily stresses of student life. Yoga is an incredible practice for supporting holistic health and inner peace - our goal is to share this experience with everyone! The UBC Yoga Club is located on the unceded, traditional, ancestral, and occupied territories of the hən̓q̓əmin̓əm̓ (Halkomelem) speaking xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam) nation.

423.description: The UBC Young Liberals are the UBC branch of the Young Liberals of Canada, and are affiliated with the federal Liberal Party of Canada. The YLC’s mission is serving as a strong voice for the values and priorities of Young Liberals within the party while promoting Liberal ideals and policies to all young Canadians. The UBC Young Liberals offer opportunities for members to learn more about politics, the Liberal Party, and policies. Events hosted create an open-minded environment centered on respectful debates and provide unique opportunities for networking, career development, and personal growth. Some events planned for the year include policy cafes where members get to create policies based on research and facts which is then sent to the relevant ministry for consideration. Maybe your policy gets adopted in the House of Commons! Other events include meet and greets with Members of Parliament, federal Ministers, and staffers, allowing you to ask questions and explore potential career paths. Club socials are a great place to meet other like-minded students and expand your network. We are always curating our events based on issues our members feel drawn to, so please let us know what matters to you, and we'll make it happen! To join, you can email us at ubc@youngliberals.ca , DM us on Instagram , or use the form on this page. Feel free to reach out to us with any questions as well. We look forward to having you.

424.description: The UBC New Democrats Club is a democratic, cooperative student organization dedicated to fostering progressive change. We provide a platform for students to connect, exchange ideas, and share experiences, skills, and information. Our members work together to discuss and advocate for progressive policies and initiatives both on campus and beyond. The club actively hosts events such as Election Watch Along Parties and Pints and Politics with local NDP politicians.

426.description: The Undergraduate Chemistry Society (UCS) is a student-run organization dedicated to promoting chemistry campus-wide and in our community. UCS hosts several social events throughout the school year to provide networking opportunity for students and professors. This includes our famous 2-Bucks-a-Beaker mixer where students can relax and meet their peers, all while breaking lab rules and drinking out of beakers! We also host the Faculty Meet & Greet , where students can mingle with their instructors outside of a classroom setting. To end the year with even more fun, we host our annual Chemiformal event with a dinner, DJ, games, & prizes! But the UCS is about more than just social events! We also host informative events such as a Lab Tours, Research Poster Making Workshop and Graduate Information Sessions with representatives from a variety of universities. Our annual Chemistry Forum and Chemistry Undergraduate Research Conference events highlights the versatility of a chemistry degree with talks from professionals in the industry and academia, and features undergraduate chemistry student research respectively. In addition, we host chemistry apparel sales, exam pack sales, locker sales, & model kit exchanges throughout the year! To stay up to date on all of our events & projects, follow us on Facebook and Instagram ! You can learn more about us at our official website too.

430.description: Hi! We are University Christian Ministries. We are an on-campus club focused on community and walking with God together. Everyone is welcome here, regardless of your background! We have larger group gatherings on Thursday evenings, ranging from worship nights to socials to outreach nights. We also have smaller core groups on Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings, both single gender and coed, who meet to study the bible and fellowship together. We will be holding our annual general meeting this Thursday, March 6th, in which we will vote on and elect our new 2025/2026 executive team

431.club_name: University of British Columbia Integrated Sciences Students Association

432.club_name: University of British Columbia Marketing Association
432.description: The University of British Columbia Marketing Association (UBCMA) is a student-led and marketing-centered club that provides value-packed events and development opportunities for students of all years and faculties. Our mission is simple: Educate, Engage, and Execute. We execute events that educate students about the inner workings of the Marketing field and engage them in leveraging their newly acquired knowledge and skills. Get to know more about our mission, our values, and the team that embodies it.

433.club_name: University of British Columbia Mechanical Keyboard Society

434.description: The UBC Vaccine Literacy Club (UBC VLC) disseminates accurate age-appropriate and culturally relevant information on vaccinations to communities in British Columbia, building capacity to overcome vaccine hesitancy and promote vaccine acceptance. We share information on the safety and effectiveness of vaccines to communities and groups through social media, infographics, webinars, panel events, workshops and a children's book. We produce engaging materials to encourage vaccine confidence, the adoption of public health measures and evidence-based decision-making. Vaccines are fundamental tools for preventing infectious diseases, and the COVID-19 pandemic revealed how vaccines are critical to protecting our communities including vulnerable individuals who can only be protected through sufficient vaccination rates reaching herd immunity. The COVID-19 pandemic has also shown that complex factors influence the decision of accepting vaccines and that we must approach vaccine-hesitant individuals with empathy.

435.description: Welcome to the Hanfu Culture Club at UBC, where tradition meets modernity! At our club, you'll have the unique opportunity to immerse yourself in the rich heritage of Hanfu—traditional Chinese clothing that spans thousands of years of history. Whether you're new to Hanfu or a seasoned enthusiast, our events are designed to offer a hands-on cultural experience like no other. Join us and step into the elegance of Hanfu by trying on these exquisite garments, each piece a testament to ancient craftsmanship and beauty. But our club is about more than just clothing. We host a variety of cultural activities that allow you to explore different facets of Chinese culture. From painting traditional fans and mastering the art of tea ceremonies to experiencing the fragrant world of incense and crafting intricate jewelry and lanterns, our events are a gateway to a deeper understanding of Chinese traditions. By becoming a part of our community, you'll not only gain new skills and knowledge but also meet like-minded individuals who share a passion for culture and history. So, why wait? Join us at the Hanfu Culture Club at UBC, make new friends, and embark on a cultural journey that will leave you enriched and inspired!

437.description: What is the VOC? We’re a member-run student club with interests in all human-powered outdoor recreation activities. Trips run from the beginner-friendly to the expert-only and everything in-between. Feel free to read on here, but if you like what you hear please do visit our website ! What does the VOC do? Members run trips basically every weekend, year round. VOC members post on our trip agenda , message board, and Discord server to plan all kinds of trips. You’re encouraged to sign up and come along. If you have somewhere you want to go, put up your own trip! Trips are free, you’ll have to chip in for gas and buy your own food but that’s basically it! We also maintain a number of back country huts for use by the larger outdoor community. And, you can rent gear from the clubroom for a small, refundable deposit during these times . For lots more information about the club, check out our WIKI ! What does membership do for me? How much does it cost? A year long membership costs $45 for UBC students and $70 for everyone else. To get a membership, sign up at Clubs’ Days or drop by the clubroom during the gear hours. Alternatively, fill out the membership form linked at the bottom of this page at anytime and come by the clubroom during gear hours with your membership cash. We promise we are working on online payment, it’s just not ready yet. Your membership fee gets you: Access to member run trips The ability to borrow gear for free Access to our library of maps, guidebooks, and other outdoor literature A VOC journal, detailing trip stories of the year Access to the VOC message board with more trips, cheap gear, tons of information, and conversations about the outdoors … and so much more! What if I’m new to the outdoor scene? The VOC is made up of a large number of students with varying degrees of outdoor experience. While many of our trips are quite challenging, a large dose of enthusiasm can often make up for a lack of experience, and there are many trips posted that are not as challenging and do not require much – or any – experience. Keep an eye out for informal “schools,” designed to help beginners develop skills and beginner friendly trips which are geared towards novices and learning. Outdoors people of all skill and experience levels are encouraged to join! Where is the VOC located? You can find us in the basement of the AMS Nest . Drop by on your lunch break and hang out to talk about your latest trip or to plan your next one. SIGN UP NOTE: If you make a new account, you won’t be able to log in until you have paid your membership dues ($45) and then your account will be immediately activated.

438.description: A community of people who follow or want to learn more about veganism either as a diet, a lifestyle or a philosophy. We hope to support people who are already vegan or wanting to transition through the mean of community, education, or advocacy. Expect lots of social gatherings surrounded by delicious vegan food, guest speaker presentations, intriguing discussion topics, vigorous advocacy and a supporting community who share similar values and want to make the world a more compassionate place.

439.description: We’re a group of students looking to make VSA a home base not only for Vietnamese students but for all UBC students. We love to share Vietnam's delicious foods, trendy fashion, music, and more with the community! In addition, one of our biggest goals is to connect students together by providing opportunities to make friends, join a network, and most importantly, a family . If you’re also ham ch ơ i and love to help create a lifetime of fun memories with us, you’ve found the right place! Don’t worry, we are also ham h ọ c --- we’re a whole package that supports our students’ academic, social, and cultural journeys.

440.description: About Our Foundation We are a community service organization here at UBC, dedicated to providing opportunities in the many ways we can support the visually impaired community. Our club hosts a variety of events throughout the year, including fundraisers, awareness campaigns, educational sessions, and career opportunities. We provide the public with the opportunities, information, and connections necessary to be involved and make a difference with the visually impaired community.

441.description: The AMS Voice Acting Club is dedicated to exploring and celebrating the unique art of voice acting. Our purpose is to provide a platform for students to learn, grow, and connect through the shared passion for voice performance. Unlike traditional film and television acting, voice acting focuses on the creative possibilities of the voice as a standalone instrument, enabling participants to convey emotions, characters, and stories in ways that rely solely on vocal expression. Through workshops, collaborative projects, and professional guidance, members will develop skills such as vocal modulation, character creation, and audio storytelling. The club also promotes an appreciation for the uniqueness of voice art, encouraging students to experiment with diverse styles and techniques, from animation dubbing to audiobook narration. By fostering an environment of creativity and collaboration, the Voice Acting Club aims to nurture not only professional growth but also meaningful friendships among members who share a love for this distinctive and powerful art form.

442.description: Welcome to the UBC Wargamers!! Your one stop for all things tabletop, we specialize in Board games, RPGs, Magic, Pokemon, and Warhammer , for which we host weekly, free, drop-in game nights available to everybody ( including non-members )!!! Our goal is to be a friendly, welcoming space for both new and experienced gamers. We strive to create a community centered space that allows people to connect over their passion for tabletop hobbies, or discover new ones! Whether you are brand new to any of the scenes we dabble in, or have decades of experience, you are likely to find someone with similar interests and goals within our club. Feel free to swing by one of our 3 weekly drop-in nights , or any of our countless events throughout the year–check out our calendar for all the details or join our discord to start getting connected with our community!! If you're a fan of board games, want to play them with your friends, or are looking to make new friends over a game, you’re sure to find one among the 200+ games in our library . If you’re looking to run a board game event, or just a board game night with a few friends, we also offer board game rentals (free for club members!). Our weekly board game night runs every Wednesday from 5-10PM in Room 3206 at the AMS Nest , and we’ll be hosting board game events throughout the semester, details are in our calendar!!

443.description: Women in Data Science (WiDS@UBC is a student organization at UBC dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse environment. Our mission is to empower, inspire, and connect women in the field of data science, while building a supportive community for women in technology at UBC. As a women-led tech club at UBC, we aim to advance women in technology and foster a supportive community. Through workshops, hackathons, mock interviews, case competitions and collaborative projects, we provide practical learning opportunities and support career growth for our members.

444.description: We are World Vision UBC, World Vision Canada’s largest campus base! World Vision UBC is a non-profit organization. Our club is made of 6 committees that each work to bettering both our local and global communities through our fundraisers and events. Join us to make a positive impact today!

445.description: YWiB UBC strives to inspire and connect ambitious young women to achieve their fullest personal and professional potential. ‘23 & ‘24 CUS Top Club Award Blossom Mentorship Program Philanthropy Program 800+ Event Attendees

447.description: UBC eProjects is a UBC AMS club that serves to provide a stepping stone and community for young student entrepreneurs in the UBC community. At eProjects, our purpose is to connect aspiring entrepreneurs and innovators with the resources, opportunities, and industry connections to enable students to flourish in Vancouver’s ever-growing startup sphere. We believe that big ideas start up small. Join us to gain more knowledge, resources and connections in the start-up and entrepreneurship fields in 2024/2025!

448.description: nwPlus is a student-led club supporting aspiring programmers and designers, based out of University of British Columbia. Our mission: foster innovation and creativity in tech for students to connect with passionate peers and mentors, through events such as our annual hackathons. By providing the right tools, resources, and support, the team at nwPlus aims to encourage students to gain hands-on experience with cutting-edge technology outside of classroom settings.
